review: Glad I came back!  Don't remember why I didn't like it the 1st time.... But, I'll be returning!!  =)  The hubby and I shared the fried zucchini appetizer, YUMMERS.  We then each had a side salad (HUGE).  Then decided to share the prime rib dip sandwich.  I had mentioned to the waitress that we were planning to share the plate.  She brought it to us already divided (with no additional charge). We each had our own au jus and fries.  Really nice experience.  Plus the unlimited fries is a BONUS!!  =)

Great place for a quick burger and/or chicken sandwich. Sweet potato fries are worth the  additional $.79, they even offer free refills on fries. Although after half of a chicken sandwich I was full, the proportions are perfect for Greg (the food) Train.

For the last 3 weeks, been there once every week. I love their food. It's basically a burger joint. However, there's so much variety. Oh, they have big ol' bottomless steak fries with their special seasoning (you can find their seasonong on any table you sit at). If you're not in a mood for a burger, they have chicken sandwiches, soups, not a big variety of wraps though, However they have a decent amount of appetizers - great for group events.  Overall, I'm there for their great customer service. My server was fantastic (Jody), she was on top of things. Everytime, I've been there I have requested her since.  Although, it gets busy Fridays thru Sundays. It's worth being patient. If the food is good, the wait is worth it. That's how I feel when I go to Red Robin.  Beware this is a kid-friendly place, so there will be a lot crying. I love children, so I'm able to put up with them and very patient. You can ask additional stuff such as extra veggies, condiments, etc. People who are have allergies or who do not want to consume gluten or/and vegetarians they have several options for them. One last thing, they have this Royality card. If you sign up, you get a free appetizer which expires 2 weeks once you activate it. You're eligible for a daily drawing to win daily prizes. You get promotional items in your email as well as after your 9th purchase, you get a free entree, appetizer or dessert. Absolutely love the idea.

Reading the other reviews, I'm beginning to wonder if I was at the right place... Anyway the Red Robin in Plaza Bonita was a serious disappointment.   Seriously. A big disappointment.  I really wanted to like this place.  I've seen the commercials and thought I was in for a treat--NOT!  My friend who came with me tried to warn me about the food, that we should go some place else, but on her previous visit to this same Red Robin (she came with someone else), she ordered a salad, not a burger, so I still wanted to go and try Red Robin for myself. Well, I ordered the classic cheeseburger, which arrived barely warm and overcooked.  The patty wasn't juicy at all (rather dry).  The cheese was plastered to it, as though it had been sitting under a heat lamp for half an hour.  The lettuce was wilted. The taste was not memorable--was I supposed to season it myself using the Red Robin's Special Blend on the table??  The bun tasted like they just took it out of a bag and threw the over cooked hamburger on it.  It came with the wilted lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, but nothing on that burger was working in harmony like you'd think it would at a place that claims it serves gourmet burgers.  The steak fries were OK, but no one mentioned anything about them being bottomless--guess I missed out on that one, but you'd think the server would have piped up and offered??  I have to admit that the staff there is very cheerful and pleasant, but perhaps a bit inexperienced.  There was trash on the floor that most of the staff was oblivious to.  After about 40 minutes, one guy actually saw the litter and stopped to pick it up.  No one even asked how the meal was or anything.  I probably should have just sent the burger back and asked for a fresh one, but oh well...  Needless to say, I'll follow my friend's lead next time and won't return.  I could have gotten a much better burger at Carls Jr. for half the price.
"Red tavern burger" sucked ass!!! It tasted like a whopper from BK. Our server, jennifer was awesome.
Jennifer was my waitress and she was so GREAT!! Very down to earth and she was on top of re filling my freckled lemonade :)

I grew up around a Red Robin so I already knew what to expect. Their burgers are good and they offer a decent variety on the menu. The service was good and very accommodating. I will return to this location again.

My husband and I, along with our 5 month old, stopped in. I asked the host if it was at all possible to eat outside on their "patio" since we had a stroller, and out child was sleeping. (Any parent knows why this was important to us.) I explained that I worked in this business as well, and I knew it was busy and if it was a problem, I understood. She said she would ask the manager, which she did, and the manager, I was told, said yes. She told us to pick a place to sit, brought us menus, and told us she let the server know. We wait, and wait. I picked the seat near the door so we could see into the bar area and so we would be seen as well, just in case we would be forgotten about. I even went inside and spoke with the host again, in case she forgot we were there. We wait some more. I notice multiple servers and even a manger walk by the door and make eye contact with me. NO ONE EVER CAME!!!  I understand they were busy, but, being a service manager myself, if you notice people outside, maybe check on them or follow up with a server/manager. Or maybe the manager should not have said yes to the request if they couldn't handle it.  We finally left. We walked by 30 min later, our menus were still on the table. Thank goodness we didn't sit and wait longer. My husband and I were looking forward to a meal together, out in public! Any parent knows what a rare occasion that can be.  So, thanks Red Robin and the manager for making it a night to remember... wait, scratch that.... a night I hope to forget.

I am a trollop when it comes to patty melts, and I was happy to see they had one on the menu here for $8.99 which came with all you can eat steak fries! ( )   I had them make the melt medium and they gave the cooking temp justice. The melt was very good. The beef patty was flavorful and juicy. ( ) The sauteed onions were succulent and tender. I like that they served the Thousand Island on the side, so that I could control the amount I put on my patty melt. The marbled rye was perfectly grilled and had a great crunch with a nice rye flavor. Great patty melt to say the least. The steak fries were good, but my first serving came lukewarm. My second serving came steaming hot straight out of the fryer. They had a crunchy exterior and soft flavorful center. They were much better than my first serving. ( ) The service was great. It was a little intrusive when I first arrived, but I politely told them that I had not even had a chance to check out the menu. After that, everything went smoothly and was on point. My refreshing iced tea was refilled several times, ( ) and I was asked how my meals was and if I needed anything else. Good service. Go Patty Melts!

Came in on a Friday night with the family. Was seated within 10-15 minutes. Jose was our waiter and took good care of us. We were ten minutes early for their late night happy hour. He took my drink order and put it in right at the start of happy hour. Ordered the Burnin' Love burger. Nice and spicy. We've been to Red Robin a few times already and it's nothing better than any other joint. Wrote this review to recognize Jose who was excellent. Checked in on us frequently and have prompt refills on drinks and fries. Average burger restaurant prices but great happy hour prices after 8pm. Stop by after 8pm Monday-Friday if you want a cheap cold beer and a good burger with unlimited fries.

I would have liked this much more if I wouldn't have frequented a topnotch Red Robin for years prior to trying this one in Bonita. Reasons to go: 1) Menu.  Burgers are unique & tasty! 2) Bottomless fries.  The home-style fries are pretty good with the Red Robin seasoning. 3) Location. It is on the outside of the mall and a great option while shopping. Reasons to avoid: 1) Value.  At this particular location, the service and quality of food simply doesn't match the prices that are paid. 2) Location.  You can pay under the amount of Red Robin and get better quality food next door at the Mexican restaurant. 3) Service.  I have a few pet peeves that abrasively irk my soul: bad drivers, people who don't pick up their dog's p00p (especially if I have to clean it off my shoe) & not getting the check paid for when I am ready to leave a stinkin' food establishment.  These guys hit hard enough on the third that I am not going back.  Too many other options with El Torito next door and the food court inside.

Not the best place in the world to get a burger, since it's part of a chain of restaurant and that never makes me a fan, that and the fact that the only sort of good beer is the Sam Adams seasonal lagers.. anywho... I'll give the place four stars mainly because you can make any burger a Vegan Pattie or a Gardenburger. As a vegetarian there are not so many places you can do that, and yo have to settle for the Veggie burger they have predetermined for you. Hey! Vegetarians want sauteed mushrooms, or jalapeño in our burger!  The server was nice, even tho we waited a bit for fries but it really didn't matter.. If you are going to share your burger, let the server know so they cut the burger for you and you don't have to get all messy in your table trying to cut the burger in half.. just saying!  Will probably come back, but no so soon.. tho the endless fries are very very tempting!

Not to sound like a beezy, but whenever I step into a restaurant, I always expect service to be good ( no service, no tip and that's my rule ). I'm pretty blunt. I've only been to This restaurant twice, and twice I told myself " sure why not give this place another try"..but I knew in the back of my head if you don't like it the first time, you probably won't like it the second time. Came here on a Monday night with my boyfriend and we were seated in the corner of the restaurant close to where the exit was. At first I didn't mind, but my boyfriend kept on mentioning how freezing it was because people would be exiting and coming in through the exit every 5 minutes or so. I also noticed that we were seated far away from everybody else as well and this made the servers less likely to come to our area.  We ordered a salted caramel milkshake which tasted extremely salty so we had to get the attention of a waitress and asked to get it remade with less salt. When our food finally arrived ( with a different waitress before ) we asked about our salted caramel milkshake and she looked confused, when I overheard her talking with the bartender that made our drink, he said " no they didn't want it, they said it tasted too salty ." The waitress came back and apologized telling us she would remake it. When it was remade and finally set on our table, we took a sip and it turned out to be a vanilla milkshake. No hint of caramel whatsoever. We asked to take it off our bill and the waitress looked a bit upset. She ignored us the whole night except for refilling our fries and when we were finished we waited almost half an hour just getting our bill. I don't think there will be a third time visiting...ever.

I have been a fan of Red Robin for a long time.  Good rewards program, bottomless fries, Guinness on Tap, good burgers with a variety to choose from, and a late happy hour.  Lately I have had a disappointing experience.   They no longer have Guinness on tap, straight out of the bottle, and while their burger selection is still pretty good, more often than not, my burger has been overcooked to burnt.  I ALWAYS ask for the burger "pink".  I have never gotten it the way I ordered it, but I can usually deal, most places have trouble cooking a burger with any rareness, so I am used to it.  On my last visit, rather than being even close to pink, it was charred around the outside and way over done.  Pretty much the opposite of what I asked for.   Because of this and a few other times the food was sub-par, I believe the  quality control has gone down hill.   So to sum up, Red Robin has gotten rid of two of my preferred menu items, Guinness on Tap, and French Onion Soup, burgers are not made as requested, and they really have not improved their menu with any of the recent changes made.   Given these developments, I will be looking for other places to spend my money.
It was a busy night so i assume thats the reason the our app came out the same time as dinner. No worries im sure ill still go back.

Decent service, great tasting food and too expensive.  Who do they think they are serving astronomical prices for a burger?  Almost had me skipping on over to Johnny Rockets before they closed down.  We Ordered: Bleu Wave burger with bottomless fat-asss fries Cobb Salad Both were extremely delicious that it felt like the X-Games in my mouth.  Just so much flavor and fat! The bleu burger had bleu cheese obviously with crispy thin fried & battered onions along with the standard veggies and condiments on it.  The flavor just hit the spot for me... I was looking for a mama to slap IT WAS THAT good, but instead the new years resolution-ers that just came out of the gym next door decided to pick this place to blow their diet and say, "I'll start my diet again tomorrow." ... so in short no slapping took place.  The cobb salad was big, protein worthy, delicious and expensive.   Service was fine, nothing special, nothing spectacular.  She had me debating on giving her a 10% or the standard 15%... She never refilled my glass of soda and you gotta be damn sure that if you're paying $3 for a soda she better get her ass over to my table and refill it as many times as I want to get my $3 worth! ... but she didn't.  I ended up giving her the 10%.  Sorry Lady, but you blew it!  Can't do your job I can't calculate 15%.

Not my preferred burger joint, but I'll go if someone wants me to go and/or is craving Red Robin and/or if I'm feeling too lazy to suggest to this person the better local burger joints. Atmosphere and service was decent. Got my refills promptly. They do what they're known for pretty well - namely their steak bottomless fries and their freckled lemonade. Both are quite addicting and before you know it you'll have finished either/or or both before you finished your burger. I'm not a ketchup person so the fries can be a bit plain without them - try them with the signature seasoning salt. The lemonade is very sweet and the strawberries are sweet enough to munch on as a dessert. For some reason I ended up getting fish & chips. My brother made fun of me as I got FISH AND CHIPS at a BURGER JOINT. I think I'll stick to burgers, as I have gotten much bigger and much better quality fish & chips for about the same price at pubs, even with the vinegar and tartar sauce. The gooey chocolate brownie cake is anything but gooey - Chilis does it better. The cake was quite dry. Also don't see how it can be any better with strawberries. Supposedly they have a St. Patricks Day shake - Guinness, Jameson and chocolate ice cream. Now I know how to make Irish Car Bomb shakes! Sweet!

I love Red Robin.  This location is like the others.  The wait time usually is not that bad.  The service was good.  The food is always great.  The burgers are delicious and fries are scrumptious and BOTTOMLESS.  My wife loves the freckled lemonade.
Burgers is okay, Fries is thick and yummy, the service can use some improvement. I wouldn't  eat there  all the time unless I am really craving for their Fries "just saying".

If I'm starving and have no idea where or what I want to eat, Red Robin is the first place that pops in my mind.  Endless fries?? For reals!!  They have THE BEST turkey burger patty here along with a variety of other yummy favorites like their fish & chips!!  It's cod, too!  I like that you can make your own burger at a reasonable price and not have to pay $15 for a gourmet burger when you can get a delicious one made here.  I also love their mud pie.  Red Robin, you rock!!!  EXCELLENT SERVICE BY TAMMY by the way, every dining company need more servers like her, she's ON IT and deserves a raise!  WE LOVE HER!  Keep it up Red Robin, because you have lots of customers that keep coming back your way!  Awesome and affordable, I like that!

One of my comfort food spots in the Southbay. I love coming into Red Robin when I don't feel like cooking or have been out and about on the weekends. Its also a cool spot to watch a game while the wife is shopping. The staff there is friendly, professional and the food is good.

the food was good...as usual...it came pretty quickly..my lemonade was good but my boyfriends absolut freckled lemonade didn't taste like it had any liquor. They remade it and the manager brought it n apologized very good customer service in my eyes....would have been a 5 if we didn't have to ask for silverware n a better drink
Fun, low key restaurant in the Plaza Bonita mall.  The waitstaff is great.  I ordered the chicken Ensenada, which was pretty good.  I also sampled my sisters hot wings, which were pretty tasty.

I used to come here all the time.  So last night was our first time back in 3 years.  Burgers are still on point.  Our waitress "Melissa" was very nice & efficient!  I ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger with the Garden patty instead of the beef  with a side salad.  It was delicious!! Can't wait to come back!
I love the fact that they have bottomless fries and the server was courteous and knowledgeable.  However, the burger was nothing special.

Not bad for a chain joint. Not great for a food snob. I would never come here of my own accord, but I always enjoy it when other people are craving it and bring me along.  I have eaten here several times. My best experience was this last time. They have a special "Berserker Burger" on the menu to promote some action movie that's coming out. I subbed the veggie patty in for the meat patty. Other than that, I left it as it is on the menu. The burger has spicy onion straws and a few others things on it. The flavors are really well balanced, and it has a good amount of heat while still tasting like a burger.  Fries are bottomless, and the drinks just keep on coming. Definitely a step up from the food court nearby.

Floors were discussing today, my shoes kept slipping in mystery liquid, my table was sticky and the menu was also sticky. The food was good, but eating in a dirty area and on a dirty table is a real turn off. I love going to Red Robin and hope that this is not a trend for this location.

Excellent service!  I would give this location four stars if they hadn't burnt my hamburger.  I think medium well=burnt.  Should have got it medium, it would have been well done, but at least not burnt. They have tasty drinks.  I tried the cherry lime flip and it was really good.   We had spinach artichoke dip that was really good, but the portions were small.

I recently came in to celebrate my birthday here and need I say that I loved every minute of it. I have never been to a red robin before and the experience that I recieved was well worth the anticipation.  The food... was amazing!!! My favorite item of the night was the tower of onion rings with campfire mayo!!! So bomb. Service.... My server was so kind and so attentive to my big group of 10. She really went the extra mile in making sure that I had the best experience ever. She really worked out the itty bitty things for us like more refills more fries extra sauces and seperate checks. If I'm correct her name was melissa. :)))  Will definitely come back for more onion rings and great service. Thanks red robin for making my birthday a memorable one to remember.
Havent been to a red robin where the food sucked. Always good service. Never sent food back. Yum

On our way to a concert, we decided to stop here for dinner. It was still early so the dinner rush had not started. We were seated in the bar area by the hostess. Our server came over and took our drink order and then returned for our food order and that was the last time we saw her. Someone else brought out our food and we had to ask another server for refills of our drinks. No one checked to see how our food was...no sort of serve whatsoever. Normally when a server leaves for a break or end of shift they stop by with their relief and let you know who will be helping you...nothing. We had been done eating for probably 10 min, our plates had been cleared and we were looking for someone to get us our check so we could go. Very disappointed in the service especially considering it was not busy. The meal itself was good, but poor service would turn me off to visiting again
Gina is a very good waitress

I am changing my review from 3 stars to 1 star. I went here recently for lunch. The place was MAYBE 1/4 of the way full and I counted at least four waitresses and a hostess on the floor when I came in. I waited with my kids for about five minutes  before we were seated (and we were the only ones waiting). We were seated and the waitress took our drink order right away (we all just got waters). Those came quickly, she disappeared for about ten minutes and didn't come back for our food order until I ran out of water. She took our order, refilled my water and disappeared again. It took a good 25 minutes for our food to come out and I saw two tables that came in AFTER us get their food while we waited. My poor kids waited so patiently, I think they did better than I did. I was ready to leave when our food finally came out. It was good, but not worth the wait and low blood sugar.  My youngest had to go the bathroom, so I took both of my kids (they're young), leaving my sunglasses on the table. We passed our waitress, I informed her that we would be back in a minute. I don't know if she was spaced out or what, but we were in the bathroom for no more than 2 minutes and when we came out our table was cleared off, including my sunglasses. I sat down and waited for the disappearing waitress. I was there for a couple minutes, flagged her down and explained what happened. She disappeared into the kitchen and I waited another 7 or 8 minutes and never saw her or my sunglasses again :( I don't think I will ever be going back to this Red Robin. Or any of them. There are far better choices in San Diego.

Food was good. Only thing was the service. This is my 2nd time here and service is bad. Both times here they were under staff. So 2nd here and there was only one waitress for about 10 tables. Just hate waiting for a server.
Good burgers and fries! Fries are unlimited and the seasoning is delicious! I remember going to a red robin back in high school with a bunch of friends and eating 20 baskets of fries! lol...

An utter disappointment. Maybe I'm spoiled by the many other delicious burger joints in San Diego, but my friend and I who dined here even compared it to McDonald's and sadly, we agreed at McDonald's would've been better.  The main point of our complaint was the food, we both ordered our burgers medium rare and the burger was overcooked therefore, they were burnt. The other problem with our burgers was the fact that it tasted PLAIN! The only flavor was the charred taste. I ordered the guacamole and bacon burger and there was such a thin layer of guacamole that I didn't taste it through the lettuce. The bacon tasted as though it was cooked once then microwaved and thrown into my burnt burger.  As for the bottomless fries, no one offered us a refill on them. Much less offered us more water to wash down the burnt flavor.  At the end of the day I would never return to this location nor would I recommend it to anyone... Unless burnt burgers with no flavor are your thing.

Enjoy their speckle lemonade, endless fries, and burgers.  The salted caramel shake is a glass full of joy. Staff service has always been consistent. The atmosphere has all the accommodations of a sports bar minus the sports bar attitude.

Came here on a Thursday 11/21/13 at 11:45am for lunch. My server Lisa was super slow at everything. My appetizer plate came out dirty with old food on it. To top it off we had no utensils. Red Robin has good food but the service today was awful. I had to talk to three different servers to get what we needed.

Love, love this place! My boyfriend and I come all the time. Bottomless fries?! Refill on fries has to be the best idea for a burger lounge. Red Robin has the best strawberry lemonade, "freckled lemonade," ever. Jalapeño coins are to die for if you like a hint of spice for an appetizer. Favorite burger would be the Cry Baby style on a Red Tavern's double. Definitely recommend you make a trip here!

Simply divine! I have had the pleasure of eating at an Red Robin many years ago out of state and it was a great experience. The food is delightful. I suggest getting the onion ring stand, at least that's what I call it. You can either get 6 or 12 nice size onion rings on a rack. Great for ring lovers. If you love burgers then you will love all the many selections they have. I say each time you visit try a new burger. The only thing I had to check them on was the milk shake was ordered to go. They didn't fill it up to the top. And if you know milk shakes you know it's filled to the top not 3/4's that's a milk shake sin... However, they were nice enough to take and fill it up. That's good customer service. Thanks "Tamara" our server.

About time! This was my second attempt here and this time we were able to not only be seated in a timely manner, but also had a pretty awesome server. The hostess tried to ensure that we had a handicap accessible table due to the fact that my grandmother was dining with us and she uses a walker which takes up more room and also means that my grandmother needs to be able to get in and out of her seat with ease. In regards to the food my daughter ordered a Black Pepper Bacon burger on ciabatta which she loved. She said it was cooked to perfection. My grandma got a simple double cheese burger from the kids menu which was just the right size since she doesn't have a huge appetite. As for myself I ordered the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad without beans, I wish the description would've mentioned it had onions... Since I hate onions. Thankfully it didn't have much and I was able to pick them out and the chicken was perfectly grilled and nice and moist.

It's getting a two because of the food. I ordered the Burnin' Love and it was good, I've had better burgers elsewhere. The refill fries are in a smaller serving than I have seen at another Red Robin location. The restaurant is nicely themed and has interesting decor.  The staff is horrible. Our waitress was impossible to waive down, it seemed as if she was trying everything to avoid eye contact with us. At one point she was walking by, and I asked her for napkins and fries, but she did not hear the fries part because she didn't even stop to listen to what else I wanted, she kept on walking and left me talking by myself. If I had been by myself I would have walked out. Every time she came by I had to basically quickly yell what else I wanted so she could hear my requests as she would drop off things and leave. I know they're busy, but that was just ridiculous. Never going back to this location.

The food is gross and the service is slow. I had a burger, can't recall the name of it but it's was runny. Way too much sauce on it which made the bread mushy from the time it arrived at the table. Falling apart and no flavor. Waitress wasn't friendly and payed little attention to our table.

This location is nice inside, the food is good, and the hostesses are nice, but I think the waitstaff is lacking.   Personally I felt the appetizers were small for the price. The waiter we had on our most recent visit was polite but very hard to get ahold of, he just wasn't around much. I also think this location does not give large enough baskets of fries. We always end up needing to order a second basket right when we get our first basket in order to prevent time with no fries.  I think this location could be improved with: -smaller sections for waiters/waitresses to help customers get more attention. -larger servings of the bottomless fries to please the customers and lower the amount of times the waitstaff has to tend to the customers.

I loved this place! The only bad thing is that one, if you go on a saturday then you have to wait for like 30-40 minutes to get seated. Second, the drinks are pretty expensive. So if you want to go there and eat this place is perfect. But if you want to drink then you should better go to a bar. I had their patron margarita and it was OH SO GOOD!

Went to dinner at the Plaza Bonita Red Robin with my family to celebrate after the 49ers game. Was seated promptly and everything seemed fine until our server introduced himself... - consistently had to ask for refills - had to get up and go to bar to ask for refill after asking for one - very unattentive - walked by us at least a dozen times without asking how our food was or if we needed anything (which we did) - never asked if we wanted more fries (they're bottomless...C'MON...we really have to ask???) - even the manager walked by and looked at our empty fries baskets and empty sodas and didnt do anything I understand that places get busy and at times it gets hard to accomodate your customers but it was very dead at this location and time. I have been to the UTC Red Robin several times and I have never had to ask for a refill on anything and I felt like a priority. Maybe the UTC location should be the training center. Buh-Bye

Red Robbin is pretty good. But I didn't like the fact we can't start with fries anymore. That's one of the big things their known for and now we can't start with them. Other then that, the food was good.

I would have given more stars of it wasn't for the manager.  My boyfriend and I went in for lunch and were looking forward to using our royalty card to get out free item. My boyfriend had to change his order because his first one didn't qualify as the free item. Only to find out that we can't get the free burger because my card wasn't registered, even though I went on line and registered the card the night we got it. If there was a problem with my card, one of the other associates should have told me one of the other 9 times we were there. The manager came up with 101 reasons as to why we could not get the free burger. He was just very unfriendly and not willing to help one bit. Not only that but the food wasn't that good this time around.

The food here is terrible the veggie burger was a frozen patty no taste not cooked.The cod sandwich was decent at best the fruit salad was soggy and gross the fries were decent. The service was good and waiter was friendly.

The burgers are ok compared to fast food joints but as a restaurant style burger it lacks variety . The bottomless fries is a cool option but they over salt them so much i end up shaking the salt off. The onion tower has a cool presentation but there is nothing special about the flavor. Service is always good and the ambience is ok for just a quick stop, but when it comes down to the burgers is just meh.The drinks are waaay to sweet too for my taste :/
went there yesterday  evening, service was fast, waiter very niece, food was ok, drinks a little weak to my taste, i'll be back not any time soon, was very pricey to me.

We came here for the first time and really enjoyed our experience. Deeone was our server and his enthusiasm for the food here was what inspired us to get what we got. He was kind and professional! They have rewards if you get the card and the restaurant was pretty cool inside. The food was ok, the presentation was nice but I have had better. They have bottomless fries but we were too full to even finish the ones we had. The appetizers we tried tho were delicious! I had a mix of mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini the batter was thin light and crispy just how I like it. We will go here again for the free birthday burger lol.

Burgers are great, speciality drinks are delish, apps are small not filling which is perfect. My family loves coming here once a week and have a nice family dinner. It's perfect for kids and large party's.

We have gone a few times and we love their bottomless fries, I order their blue ribbon hamburguer with a side of onion rings.... wish those were bottomless too!!! they do offer a short tower of onion rings, my hubby had their regular hamburguer with fries all in all a good food and good experience.
Friday night, great service food was good, place is clean and the prices are very reasonable.
Been going here for years...but lately the service has dropped off a bit???  The food is always good and we love the atmosphere, so we will defintely be back!
Burgers here never disappoint. This place is smaller than most Red Robins though, other than that it's chill. Tv's are small but there's a lot and the bar is cool. Service is good too

This was my first time at Red Robins, and it was not what I expected. Once we arrived the hostess just looked at us and asked us to follow her. There was no greetings or anything. We sat down and looked at the menu. I was definitely overwhelmed by the different items. Once I looked up the server came by to get our drink orders. Once she came back and gave us the drinks, we asked for a little more time. Couple of minutes had passed, and we waited until she got back to us. Each time; however, she passed out table she would tell us to wait as she served another table. Couple more minutes and we were again asked to wait and she'll be back. It was a total of three times we were told to wait. By the time she came by we were definitely annoyed. She took our orders, and I had ordered A bacon cheeseburger with a side of ranch. We waited about 15 minutes for the food to be prepared, but it was beyond disappointing. The burgers were small and about the size of in n outs burger. Unfortunately, she forgot about my side of ranch, and it did not bother me until I was practically almost done with my burger and fries.... We reminded her several times and by the time, I was on my last bite she had brought it out. I don't want to be charged extra for a sauce I was not able to enjoy. And Unlike the commercials, the hamburger was miniature and finished in just 5 bites. I am not willing to pay 11 bucks for not even a quality burger. This place is definitely lacking.

Good burger joint. Many options expecially for those who eat clean. The atmosphere is good and the facilities are clean. The decor is rad and kids could have fun. Happy hour is ok and the beer selection could be better. Overall I would come back.

This is quite simply the easiest review I've ever wrote, this place is simply disgusting. Came with three of my friends. First of all out server was never around, secondly they didn't give us napkins, and third of all the food was horrible. 2 of my friends burgers were completely burned and my chicken sandwich was raw in the middle. I'm talking about pink, like I could have gotten good poisoning from this. Definitely would not recommend this to anyone unless you're in the mood to end up in the toilet 30 min later.

Horrible service tonight. Actually we didn't even get seated. Got there at 10pm to avoid the crowd. Lots of empty tables not enough servers. Waited 30 minutes for a table of three. So looking forward to bottomless rootbeer floats. Had to go to El Torito instead.  Got seated and ordered in less than 10 minutes. You disappointed tonight Robin.

Terrible terrible service burger was incorrect.  Never received a refill on my drinks untill I ordered, even then I didn't get it until I ordered my check.  While the food is good the horrible service does not make up for this place.  Management needs a huge revamp.

Ive been to this red robin various times.....so I'm just gonna say this here. Yesterday me and my boyfriend went to red Robin everything was awesome until my boyfriend found a thumb tack in his fries ...we only wanted to let them know so they could b more careful but we were super nice about it like "oh its okay we just wanted to let you know everything is great" so then the manager comes to our table really nice and everything until he proceed to tell us that he was trying to figure out where it came from as they have nothing that looks like that in the restaurant ....hinting that we put it there. Then he went on to tell my boyfriend that he would take the burger off and I was like no please don't do that....like I was so dumbfounded by how the manager was basically telling us we did it....Idk I got really sad :(

This red robbin is great to include the managers and 99% of their staff.  There is only one rotten apple. Stay clear from the server with the attitude, NAYLIA.  This is the second time we have had her and the same attitude.  I told her to cut my burger as I would share it with my daughter.  She then said it would be an extra charge.  Get the hell out if town! An extra charge for cutting my burger.  I don't think so.  She then cut me off when I was explaining I wanted extra fries w my meal as we usually devour the fries in 5.2 seconds:) yes, she has much attitude!  I asked for the manager and we were accommodated by having another server attend us the rest if the evening and the manager apologized for her and was very attentive with anything else. Make sure you don't get her as a waitress or your experience will be a 1! This red robbin is the best!

Came here a few days ago with my sister & mom & I ordered a Guacamole Bacon Burger, it was delicious ! I ate that thang in one whole bite (: Their garlic fries are good too AND bottomless which makes it even better ! I think the best thing I had was the Salted Caramel Milkshake, it was PERFECT ! I'm a big fan of Milkshakes & this was probably the best I've had (: Service was good too, our waitress was really nice & she checked up on our table consistently. Definitely coming back soon !

1st: my husband and I only returned to this location because we were given a $20 from management because of the last visit we had which was over a year ago. 1year ago: met husband for quick lunch. Ordered 2 burgers and 2 drinks. Order came 50 minutes later!!!! Husband left after 40 min because his lunch break ended. He didn't even get to eat a fry! I just about walked out but I flagged our server down-who was so busy chit chatting she didn't notice our sense of urgency, and I told her to just have them box it up. Honestly, I don't know why I didnt just cancel the order and pay for the stupid drinks...I was trying to be nice. Server apologized and explained that they had very little kitchen help and that was why they were so slow. She went out of her way to ask management to comp our meal. I thought it was just a bad experience and didn't want to write them off. Present: it was not that busy in the restaurant at 9p but it took forever to get our drink order in. We had to ask for utensils from our server. Both of us got the wrong buns for our burgers and it took over 30 minutes to get our food.  The tables and menus were sticky. Will not go back EVER. Go to El Toritos or Applebee's.  Quick service and it is cleaner! This place is a dump-employees, service, cleanliness. Come on! There are too many other competitors out there! Get it together!

I mean the food was good. I had a red robin royal burger on a gluten free bun, but idk. The service was ok and when I asked the female waitress if they had a steak knife I could use to cut my burger she gave me a butter knife. It took our waiter a longtime to bring us our check, then come and get it and mind you it wasn't that busy. Sorta a shame.

I opted to go to Red Robin and brought home a Red Tavern burger with fries and also the prime rib sandwich with au jus.  The burger I had upgraded from the tavern patties to the single regular (thought it was gonna be a double?)but honestly I couldn't tell the difference. It was a decent burger but I couldn't imagine paying this when there are better burgers for a lesser price closeby. The prime rib sandwich was good but definitely disappointing in size. Definitely not lacking in flavor though.

I've eaten here before and had a pleasant experience. I came today for my son's birthday and we ordered burgers. We were seated quickly and served drinks immediately after we ordered them. Food took a bit longer than I would've liked for burgers but it wasn't too bad. Food came and was not bad. They serve steak fries and they are all you can eat fries so the initial portion with the meal is minimal but manageable. The waitress was attentive and my only issue was not having napkins or silverware at the table. It wasn't busy so there's really no excuse for missing that part. Overall a good experience and would come back again.

When I hear bottomless... I'm there! Next time I hear bottomless and it has Red Robin in there somewhere... I'll probably pass. Not sure if it's this particular location, but they are slooooow. Our waitress took forever to take our order so when she finally came, we were able to put our food and drink order in together. One of the people in my party ordered a salad but since the waitress didn't like coming to our table, she decided to bring the salad with her burger instead. I ordered the Double Tavern Burger thing and it was a Burger King burger for sure. Just three times the price. I would say that the plus is the bottomless fries, but she decided she didn't want to bring any until we asked. Keep in mind we have a party of four and there are about seven fries on each of our plates. Three of the four had hot fries in their basket and I had semi-stale and very cold fries in mine. Luckily the ONE basket of fries she ever brought was hot so I was able to eat those. Our drinks were also never refilled and we finished them before the food was out.  I guess she had customers in the kitchen since she was hanging out in there the whole time. I'm assuming her tips are not what paid for her fake breasts. Sorry I had to go there.

This place is really nice inside. I loved the bonzai burgers. And the onion ring is one of the best one I tried. I must say I didnt like the waiter at all.he didnt give us napkins or utensil. And didnt come back at all. Overall the food was pretty good.

The service is incredibly slow. It took about 10 minutes for my party of 4 to get our drinks. They don't even have napkins on the tables and when we asked for some they gave us only one for each. The burgers were unremarkable despite their high price and they came with about 6 fries. I've had better burgers at fast food places. The root beer floats might be bottomless but you'll rarely get more than 2 refills since they take forever to get the refill.

Went here last night for dinner. I had the BLTA croissant. It was good. Service was good. We asked for more fries & they gave us a brand new batch. Every time we come here, food has been the same. My daughter had the grilled cheese & hubby had a chili burger. We will be back if we are in the area.
Just had lunch here it was pretty decent ..my chicken came out slightly under done but sh! $ happens no biggy the drinks were good my server/bartender was pretty chill and had good customer service

Me and my friends are all rewards members and have ate here several times. 90% of the time the service is horrible! Bottomless anything is no good when you can't get the server to come to your table long enough to ask for a refill. We have gotten hair in our food! The wrong orders! And one waitress in an extremely low cut shirt who refused to make eye contact with the females at the table but had no problem sticking her ladies in the males face! Get a job at hooters!! There is one all star on the team however, James he's a bartender who served our table once and was amazing! He's the only reason we go back!! He's the best! Make sure u ask for him!! (He is the other 10% from the beginning of my review)

Okay, well i just want to say that i as actually a big red robin fan!  Do I still like it here yes, this particular location.. ehh I don't think so. Alright so ill keep this short, waitress comes (nice gal) i say no pickles on my chicken sandwich, minutes later food shows up EXTRA pickles! like damnnnn, my sandwich was mega soaked! So it takes me a while to chase her down, i tell her she apologizes, picks up my food and tells me she will be back, 15 mins later, she comes back, my sandwich was nice and fresh, Yay no pickles, but the new fries she comes back with has a HAIR!! REALLY? yes really!  My boyfriend and I just ask for the checks, she apologizes once again, and tries bringing a manager over but we didn't want the hassle so we payed and left, and i was still hungry.

It was decent the first time I went, however the second time wasn't a very good experience.   The order came fast, which was good but the fries were cold.  I think instead of waiting until the burgers were done to serve the fries, they must have put the fries on the plate and waited, which made them cold.   The second time I went with my parents and my dad ordered the fish and chips, mom ordered the regular burger and I ordered what I like to call the cowboy burger.. which is onion rings, bbq sauce, etc. It's known as a cowboy burger originally.  The burger meat was over seasoned because it came out very salty.  The oil from the fat of the burger was soaking through the buns.  I couldn't finish the meal, only ate about half.   Later that night both my mom and I got sick.  We figured it was from the burger meat.  When I researched it, turns out a lot of people had that experience around the day we went.  Most likely a bad batch of meat.  My dad was fine but he ordered the fish and chips.  We never went there again, maybe in a couple years I'll give it another try but two bad experiences in a row is going to keep me away, especially that second experience since both my mom and I got sick that night.   The waitress was very nice though, a sweet older lady, we gave her a nice tip. You could tell she was working hard, probably had been there a while and was about to end her shift.  She was very nice as we explained that we didn't care for the meal.  We tipped her anyways because she was kind and it wasn't like she was the one cooking and preparing the food.

Ok, so a Red Robin is a Red Robin--I won't comment on the overall experience of eating at this chain restaurant. It is what it is. Just a couple of things about this particular location: First, for the gluten-free folks, every time I order a burger on the gluten-free bun here, it's SUPER stale. I have not had that experience at other RR locations so I don't know what the problem is here. Maybe they're storing them in the freezer too long. Second, it's always hot in there. Either they don't have air conditioning or it can't keep up. The waitstaff have always been nice, but eating a hockey puck while sweating is no fun. Update: if you do go like we just did (I never learn, apparently) avoid sitting in the bar area. The male bartender/waiter who is there at lunch time on weekends didn't write down our order and was multitasking while half-listening to our orders today. Sure enough, both of our meals were wrong--my husband's burger cooked wrong (he ate it anyway) and my burger on a bun when I ordered it in the lettuce wrap due my dietary restrictions. No apology or even glimmer of acknowledgement after I had to wait for them to make mine over again.

Super busy and still got great service. We were told there would be a 15 minute wait, but since there was only 2 of us we sat in the open seating in the bar. Our waitress was working her tail off and still greeted us right away and kept our drinks filled.  Thank you, Lisa! The menu is huge, a lot to choose from. Our burgers were delicious. I liked the free extra sauces for the fries. We will definitely be back. The only downside is the parking at the busy mall.

Fantastic service! Our food came before we were even done with our appetizer, that's four stars right there. Ordered red tavern burger, its a nice little double cheeseburger very good. Bf had guac bacon burger, he devoured it.  Portions are a bit small, at least for the couple we ordered, but so good and filling! Bottomless root beer float, can't believe it. Still can't believe it.

Probably the most annoying experience I've ever had. 1. We ordered our drinks - Blue Moon and Stella  2. Took about 15 - 20 mins after ordering our drinks to have our food order taken 3. Our drinks finally came 4. The Blue moon was flat and the color of orange juice. The most annoying part was that the bartender should have caught this and should not have served it 5. We sent back the blue moon 6. 15-20 mins later we finally get a new blue moon and it was a lot better than the first 7. 10 mins later Our food comes - not sure if it was because we were hungry, but it was probably the best part of our visit 8. We get the check 9. They charged us for two blue moons instead of one 10. Took us about 10-15 minutes to flag down a waitress to fix the mistake All in all, service here is very slow.. Not sure if they were just short staffed that night or JUST SLOW.

Service and atmosphere are solid.  Its a fun environment.   The fries are very good for steak fries.  Some are nice and crispy and some are softer.  I like the extra seasoning that they put on it. The stack of onion rings is fun to eat.  The rings are yummy with a right combo of onion to batter, and its nice and crispy.  The only thing is that they're obviously the frozen variety because they're so perfect.  They're definitely good, but there are a lot of places in SD that have more of a handmade touch. The basic cheeseburger is just ok.  Its more like a whopper because it seems like the condiments overtake the patty.  The meat doesnt have a flame grill or char character to it. The bbq chicken salad was very tasty with lots of texture.  I'd probably only come back here for the fries, and to try something other than a burger.
Server attentive,  Food was hot and fresh. New oniin ciabatta bun was killer. Get the sweet potato fries and 1,000 island dressing. You'll thank me.

I rate Red Robin a 2 because of the service. IT SUCKED ! The waitress kept leaving & not coming back at all & it lead to the point where we had to ask another worker for refills. Rude & horrible customer service at the one in the Plaza Bonita Mall. Overall, the experience from when you walk through that door is bad.

UGGHHH! What's really sad is that generally normally the service is on point & so is the food BUT tonight everything was just OFF!! I came w/ my two teenage kids at about 4pm & it wasnt busy at all. The server was nice but only checked on us one time. We didn't get to enjoy the bottomless drinks because as I said previously the server only checked on us ONCE!! I ordered the riblets & mac n cheese...the riblets were over cooked & the mac n cheese was cold in the middle...now we all know that if sumthns cold in the middles its because it was previously made & frozen until it needed to be served...thats a no no for me. I ordered a salted caramel shake my FAVORITE but it wasn't tonight because tonight it came out in this rinky dink little water cup!!! Wha da heo!?! It usually comes out in a shake class w/ the extra onv the side!!! At the end of service I was given the check that didn't have our right orders on it & I could've just paid for the one person meal I was charged for but I was honest & asked for my hefty size check for the 3 of us lol the only good thing I can say is the prices really are reasonable but other than that boo on you Plaza Bonita Red Robin boooooo!

Made a custom burger and it was amazing!' Maricela gave amazing service and was very fun and patient. It was very busy on a Saturday night and she didn't forget about us once! Keep up the great work maricela and kudos to the cooks too!'

I was kind of excited to go here for a burger because "Gourmet Burgers" was in the title.. The good: The burger was ok. It wasn't the best and wasn't the worst...Would I return here for this specific burger? No. Would I give it another shot and try something else? Maybe.  The steak fries were good and were served steaming hot so you know they're fresh.  I love the idea behind all the sauce choices however, charging .75 for each one is kinda nickle and diming.... The bathroom was not clean and there was trash/debris all over the floor of the main part of the restaurant. The service was average as well.  I was not impressed.

We had a choice to come here and El Torito and we chose to eat here.  Big mistake. Not only did they forget my garlic fries, but for 99 cents extra, what were supposed to be my garlic fries were pitifully covered in garlic salt and shredded parmesan and heated under a heat lamp. So sad. They also forgot to give me lemon with my fish and chips. Service felt cold as were my fries. Red Robin....YUUUUUUCK.

It's a red robin....and their food is consistent with any other red robin that you would go to; but their service isn't up to par (at least for a work night). Walked in with a friend of mine, plenty of open booths, some still needed to be cleaned but otherwise open...and instead of asking us where we would like to sit or even sit us where anyone would want to sit (a padded booth) we're sat at the high tables next to the bar...as are the next two groups of people, crammed together. If you lean back just a bit you run the risk of hitting the person behind you. At the time I was too hungry to care or bother to say anything about the seating. Our drink order was taken and returned quickly, as was our food, but the waiter didn't come to check up on us for the rest of the meal....and thanks to our drinks being mostly ice, they went empty pretty quickly (we each got a soda and water). He must have passed our table at least a dozen times, never once asked us if we wanted anything else to drink.... I get it when restaurants get busy you have a smaller chance of being noticed by the wait staff, but they weren't busy....and there isn't an open soda/water fountain where I can re-fill my own cup.  As customer it's frustrating and annoying when you're paying a few bucks extra for the sit-down experience and are promptly ignored.  After looking around the restaurant it seemed odd, tables weren't being cleaned off in a timely manner (one of the tables that had dishes on it was still dirty when we left) and the staff seemed overwhelmed by the few people that were there. Bottom line: food was good, but if you just want a burger and fries, go to In-n-out, or any other red robin, because you shouldn't spend the extra time and money in a sit down restaurant that is filled with unobservant and unhelpful staff. Literally the first time I've given no tip....but in my defense, it was earned.

Came here for Veterans Day and the place is packed the food still manage to come out in a decent time cooked the way I wanted it and the server did not even let my cup get half full. Although I still consider this fast food the restaurant was very clean the employees were very welcoming and professional I didn't mind giving me a good tip because they were deserving of it.

I used to work here and I'm disappointed with the service and the food.  The patties were half the size they were supposed to be. Whether it's an economic move or what, not sure. They don't have garlic butter fries anymore. Our waitress brought out drinks AFTER food was served and even after did not check up on us.  Save your money and go somewhere else. Red Robin used to be one of my favorite places, but has lost it's luster and charm in all areas of food service. Not going back here for a long time.

Red Robin...ummmm? Service was great, but the food was terribly underwhelming.  Stopped here because we were already at teh mall and wanted to squeeze every last minute of that sweet sweet rockstar parking spot that I swooped on this afternoon of Christmas week. It was either RR or Appledeez since we didn't want to deal with the holiday mob scene at the food court. Mi-Mi did a great job with customer service this evening. Food orders were taken quickly (plus delivered accurately), drinks were refilled often, and she checked on us regularly to make sure all was going well. Unless the food is complete disaster, I'm not one to send anything back. I've seen the movie Waiting. "Don't f**k with people that handle your food." -Monty Dinner plates. More misses than hits tonight. I'm glad the apps we shared are available as half orders.  -Chicken wings and chips. A half order is four pieces served over a bed of crunchy, crinkle cut potato chips. The buffalo sauce is mildly spicy with not much lingering heat. The BBQ sauce is sweeter in comparison and neither overly piquant nor smoky. What mostly grossed me out was how undercooked and fatty the birds bits were. I would've preferred a crispier exterior and cooked through for longer. -o' ring shorty. Their mini tower of 5 onion rings. Dat familiar crispy goodness perfectly uniform from the freezer and fried just right to my table. I actually like RR's rings because they are reliable at every location. -bacon cheeseburger. I added a fried egg just because. I'm glad I did because the bacon was thin, fatty and rubbery like it was microwaved. -bottomless fries. Not great this time. Mostly cold and soggy potato planks. Not even their magical seasoned salt could revive them. Other than the onion rings, the food was subpar and the service shined as tonight's saving grace. We don't frequent this location often, but compared to other RR joints, either the quality has diminished and/or the someone needs help in the kitchen. Unless we run out of nearby options we're not going to be rushing back anytime soon.

I can't believe that so many people go to this particular restaurant. The red robin in UTC is farther away, but it is far superior in every single aspect. This one in Bonita is just terrible.  My wife has some strict dietary requirements that only a few big chains cover, and thankfully red robin meets these requirements. Unfortunately, we live close to this location. We don't have too many options for dining out, and if my wife wants a night out at a restaurant that doesn't require a 45 minute drive, this is the only option:( The service is routinely slow.  Don't trust the people up front when they tell you how long the wait will be; tonight we were told 20 minutes and waited just over an hour. The food just doesn't taste as good as any other red robin, it just is bland. Also, if you order a gluten free bun, expect it to be stale, that way you won't be disappointed when it comes. They won't let you sit outside; ever. I don't know why they even bother with tables out there.  Tables sit unbused for long periods of time while the pile of people waiting u the door grows larger.  Right now I'm counting three tables with dirty dishes and 10 people waiting by the door. It just feels like the management at this location is consciously understaffing to save money.  The waiters, in my experience, don't seem particularly happy or interested in human interaction.  This place sucks.

A group of my friends and I decided to have dinner together at around 6:30 pm but it was pretty packed tonight and there was a 30 minute wait. Considering how busy it was, service was, of course, delayed but still decent. The wait time to receive our food and get refills on our drinks wasn't as bad as it could've been. I ordered the Freckled Lemonade and the Royal Red Robin burger with garlic herb fries and decided to try the bacon aioli. I really liked the Freckled Lemonade and it's definitely one of my favorite drinks there (the twisted cup it comes in is really cute). As for the burger, the patty was cooked fine but the egg was slightly underdone. Adding a little of the bacon aioli helped boost the flavor but it was just alright. It's about what you'd expect from a chain restaurant. My friends and I agreed that the food was fine and it's an okay place to meet up to eat and catch up but nothing to write home about.

First time ever at red robin. We went to plaza Bonita. Service was a mess the food was worst. I ordered soup n wrap. The chicken wrap was ok but the onion soup sucked. It was bland the bread was disgusting. I switch it to the tortilla soup. It was good but the fact that there was a hair in my soup did not jive with me! The last of our appetizer chicken tenders was not cooked thru and it took for ever to get refills. Not a good first impression:/ oh my son. Got sick from the spaghetti he ordered. So my husband n family decided to give red ribbon one more shot we went to UTC about three weeks later. Guess what everything was great. We told are waitress our story that we are giving it one last try. Everything was great. The manager at UTC came by an asked how everthing was. That was nice. Bonita never again

These guys take customer satisfaction to a new level! They've highly exceeded my expectations with their promptness and effectiveness. They took my review seriously and promised to work on the issues with that branch. Hats-off to Red Robin management team. Note: I took it up from 2-star to 4-star just because of management responsiveness, and NOT because the branch issues were solved. Still think UTC branch highly excels over Bonita branch.

If you get a waiter named Jose Luis, do not expect great service.   We went on a Wednesday night and oh man was our waiter slow. At times we had to ask more than once for a specific thing. I had to ask twice for my first refill of fries and by he time he got them my burger had gone stone cold.  Not only that but he got my order wrong to begin with. Refilling drinks seemed to be a foreign concept to the man and just getting our check ready took 15 minutes.  Also, as part of my photo , I got the supposedly spicy ghost pepper option on my burger and the effects were less satisfying than if I had just used some Tabasco.  Less than amazing service and tasteless food earns a 1 star. I don't often give those out but this was just a terrible experience.

Worst fcking service. Waited for 20mins just to get our order taken. Another 20mins to get our food which was just clucks & fries. They can't even get the fries right. I asked for garlic Parmesan but I got regular ones. I told them it was wrong. They came back with the same regular fries. Like really?! Then when they came back for the THIRD time they pretty much dipped the fries in garlic seasoning. I was so pissed already for waiting & you can't even get one small order right?! & they asked if they can try to get the fries right again. I declined & told them I don't want spit on my next one. NEGATIVE 5 stars.

Went there last night, waited for 5 minutes for a table which was not a big deal. We quickly placed our order of drinks and appitizer with our server. We ordered the 14 piece of wings with buzz sauce, when the food arrived we quickly noticed our 14 wings were only 10 and that took 20 minutes for those to come out. Advised our server who quickly got it resolved. He was VERY FRIENDLY, even though he spoke quickly and softly. we then placed our food order which was 4 burgers meals, with no special request to change or add to the meal. Very simply order with an almost empty resturant at this time. We wait, and wait about 45 min passed before I got the manager. Advised the manager of the long time, he was very apologetic, and gave us a little discount. Just reading the review now I thought they were just under staffed. Guess they just have horrible service. Will not return to this location.

This is my first visit to Red Robin. To tell you the truth, I've seen the TV commercials but didn't know we had one in Chula Vista. Too bad, I wish I would have known - I enjoyed this lunch.  Server was very friendly (Jane), she gave us the heads up on the Red Robin Royalty card. Very Cool. They give food and discounts away.  There was a little wait between the time we ordered and the food arrived at table, not too long. Food was good & filling. I had the Red's Taverns Burger & onion rings - yum! Onion rings crispy just like I like them. Mom had the Smoke & Pepper Burger, it smelled great and would have taken a bite, but mom would have given me the stink eye! Lol.  The Root Beer Float a Drinkable Dessert! Bottomless Barq's and soft serve kept looking at me but I kept my composure and just had iced tea. Pretty quiet for a lunch crowd.  I'll come back & check out dinner, then watch out Root Beer Float. I'm coming for you!

I've been to Red Robin about a handful of times in my life, not because of how amazing it is, but because I just want to go. Does that make sense? I don't crave it, per se, but if the name appears or a commercial plays, then I want to go. I don't think the advertisers are doing a good job... I just believe that I want to go because the gaps in between visits to this place are literally at least a year apart.  My favorite part about Red Robin is the unlimited strawberry freckled lemonade--it even comes in a cool cup! I would probably come here just for that drink, to be honest. Their burgers, though, let me talk about that... I'm going to speak about my latest experience because 1.) it was most recent and 2.) I don't really remember the other times. So, my boyfriend and I went to go here for linner (lunch-dinner) because I wanted a booger that wasn't too far from where we were. He had never gone either, so I thought "Why not?" I ordered the "royal red robin" because I saw it had egg, which I love, and he had the "guacamole bacon" because he didn't want to copy me (plus he wanted guac!)  Our server, who was a nice and attentive girl, asked us how we wanted our patty cooked--pink or no pink. I said, "No pink," while he said the opposite. When our burgers came out, my boyfriend's burger was pretty cooked through, except for a minimal portion. He wasn't picky about it, but he wished it had been more pink. I liked my burger, though. The yolk broke all over it, which was yummy! I was disappointed in the amount of fries the both of us received. When I used to go here, I remember getting a lot a lot a lot of fries! Nowadays, it literally looks like there a 10 fries with my burger. I get that they're unlimited, but come on now... I can finish those fries in a minute. For $.99 more, i upgraded my steak fries to garlic herb fries. Yes, they were good, but I feel like there wasn't garlic and herb to work with.

I asked for a medium burger and the burger was clearly white in the middle and pink everywhere else, but browned on the outside. Obviously, when there's white in the middle means it was kept frozen and takes out all the flavoring in the meat, so it's clearly not fresh. I just complained to the waitress that it wasn't cooked right and they offered to make me something else (but we all know how the restaurant business is)... Anyways, we ordered an appetizer and that never came. The service and food here sucks. Never coming back.
Great experience our waiter was so polite and always checking up on us very helpful I think his name was Deeon definitely coming back!

This place can get super busy. My husband and I went in for dinner on a Friday night and only had to wait 20 minutes when the place was packed. Not a bad wait time for a Friday night! Good was good, service was decent. Waitress was super nice. Over all I'm going back. Def recommending this place to my friends.  Had the Cab o wabo salad and my husband had the patty melt.  Both very good!

I wouldn't even give this place a star if i didnt have to. Ive visited this location frequently and they made 3 errors out of all those times I went there with my family. But make sure you never complain about your order if they mess it up because they will somehow make it your fault. For example me and my family visited the restaurant last night and they made a mistake on 1 out of 4 burgers. I asked for a 3rd patty on top of 2 burgers and onl one burger had the extra patty. when I brought it to the attention of the manager Anna on duty she pretty much said that were lying that she counted the patties on each burger herself? then she said that pretty much even though were lying that shell remake the burger. That doesnt do the whole situation justice after being embarrassed in front of others that were eating in the restaurant. Not only was she wrong she was embarrassing as well. This restaurant has the most mess ups out of any place Ive ever eaten!!! Not only will they tell you your wrong if you make a complaint they will call mall security on you as well

Definitely my wife and my go to date night spot when we want burgers. We each have our favorite burgers and drinks. Every time we go, the servers are super attentive in refilling drinks and fries. Food gets brought out much quicker than most places and the staff are very friendly. Is it lunch yet?

This location in particular has very bad service and all the employees that work there are all on there phones looking at there FB rather then helping the customers and the Manager is very indifferent when you explain that you have been waiting for over an hour and nobody is helping you , the manager gave an attitude and told me they where busy and there where no tables available but on the place whas almost empty and plenty of tables , went about his business and never got helped!

Had to try something different and our server "Sam" suggested the Southern Charm burger.... It was delicious and full of flavor. Service was good and Sam was on point. Never had to wait more than 1 minute for anything requested. Tonight dinner was a home run .....

If I could back up words that were written by my own hand and retract the way I feel about a place, it would be about this restaurant. Red Robin is like a fine woman when you noticed that things are better the second time around  This time around for me the hamburgers at red Robin are the best. They are full of flavor and very delicious, french fries are just like I like them, fat and meaty. I've never enjoyed a hamburger as much as I did here. I can't wait to go back again. The service was a little slow but efficient and they really do take care of you. I love you RedRobin.

I've been to various Red Robin establishments and thus far no complaints. Atmosphere: this location is right in the mall of plaza bonita. Clean high ceiling restaurants with a full bar and tv's Food: ordered the double tavern cheeseburger comes with bottomless fries. the burger was cooked about a medium rare. it was a good classic burger that wasn't too heavy.  drinks: full bar and various cocktails mixes. ordered freckled lemonade(no alcoholic) unlimited refills.  Service: good friendly service from James the bartender.  Parking: can be hard to find because of the restaurant being next to Crunch gym.  I'd come back for the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade(no alcoholic) and of course their burgers.
Great service!  We had a small party of 4.5 and had to wait 30 minutes on a weekday night not too long of a wait.  Food was good and I was able to order something healthy so I was happy!

Just another burger and french fries joint showcasing American cuisine. I felt that the atmosphere here (in terms of the interior decor) reminded of the 1950s. After all, this business started during that timeframe. I want to note that service here is great. I even saw the manager come to each table to make sure everything was all right. Good business practice! As for the food, I was really excited to try the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger. One, it registered as the "Holy Grail" burger in the burger hierarchy. Two, it was the seminal product in determining any future visits. The burger seemed like any other burger, see photos. I suppose the true distinguishing mark is the brand's way of making the product. In addition, I found the steak fries very soft and golden. It tastes so good when dipped into barbecue sauce. To conclude, I would say that the atmosphere is welcoming, service is good, but the food is not anything to be jumping unicorns and rainbows about.

Red Robin Today was great! Super crowded but the food and service was very welcoming and timely. We had the chop house burger and the bleu burger with bottomless sweet potato and steakhouse fries. We never saw the bottom of our beverages or fries. Burgers very tasty and prepared as requested. They were on it all during the visit. We would return and likely very soon.
Update: my friends and I returned and were given great service and loved our food! Thanks Annette!

I usually like Red Robin but this time, not so much. Took my niece here Friday around 5pm and the wait to sit down wasn't long. We were immidately greeted upon arriving and was told it'd be about a 10 minute wait which was closer to about 5 or so minutes. Nice! From start to finish it was a waiting game inbetween our drinks, the appetizer and then the wait for our food to arrive was starting to increase which was making us hungrier and crankier by the minute! Finally, we got our food and lets just say, after you make a grilled cheese and let it sit out, the cheese starts to look rubbery after awhile... yeah, that's what her food looked like. Here's a break down of what we got: Grilled Cheese (just make one at home yourself), Mac & Cheese (which was apparently yummy), a side of mandarins and a side of brocolli (which she liked as well). I got the Blue Ribbon burger which was okay and garlic fries (save yourself the .99 and DONT GET IT!.. there was SOO much salt it was unbearable! I only ate half of one fry). The food was only warm and didn't appear to be fresh out the kitchen which was unfortunate.  Finally, my waitress followed up with my request for my nieces birthday and provided her with an ice cream sundae and a happy birthday song which was great. Overall, the wait time for the food just wasn't worth it. Consider dining elsewhere if you're REALLY hungry.

Everyone 21+ get the Blue Haze drink its so tasty! Loved my waitress Maira B. She was attentive, a great server, whatever we asked for it didn't take long. We've never tried the sweet potato fries and she brought a basket free of charge. Overall it was a great day!

Was not happy with our Father's Day lunch here at Red Robin. My husband and I both ordered the Tavern Double.. who would've guessed it's actually a single patty? Our waitress told us next time, ask to add a patty. We believed her at the time although it seemed strange. When we got home I looked at the menu and it turns out it was supposed to be a double. So what the heck was she talking about?! We paid $10.99 for a burger when we should've gone to In-N-Out to get a much better burger for half the price. Also we weren't given any napkins for our meal and it took us a long time to see her come back around to our table to request some. We needed refills as well. We won't come back.

Went  with a friend to check out the restaurant and try the food Atmosphere: combination of  modern twist meets commercial grade technology. plenty of open space  and not too crowded Parking: ample room Prices: fair and reasonable Food: hot , on time quality gourmet burgers Fries are served in tin cups .... WHY? but could  ask for unlimited refills overall great expereince with nice server

Firstly, the food was super delicious but the service does not compare in any way. We had asked the lady if she could seat us at a table and not a booth, we waited and she quickly came for us to say there was a table available. She sits us at a booth but it was a honest mistake and promptly found a table for us which was kind. Now, the waiter (forgot his name) was friendly at the beginning and brought out drinks in a speedy time. My father ordered an iced tea and we noticed that there were no sweeteners there. We asked our waiter if he could bring some and he was fine with it, however, he was taking a while, so we asked a busser if he could give us some from the table he was cleaning. The busser was really sweet and gave them to us, we even mentioned they hadn't given us napkins nor tupperware and he was surprised. Our waiter was extremely forgetful. He actually never even brought the sweeteners we asked for, nor none of the lemon wedges we asked for with our drinks, and only brought the napkins and tupperware with our dinner (after we had already eaten our onion rings). Our food took a little longer to be brought but that was understandable due to the fact that it was so busy! My only issue with my plate was that he didn't add the avocado to my burger as I had requested but he changed it quickly and I don't think it was too major. The food was great and I always love their burgers. All in all, I would come back for the food and not the service.

Went here yesterday, had a great time, good food, and excellent service.  All the things on the menu look delicious, and everything we had to eat and drink was fantastic. Definitely worth the drive to Chula Vista. Server was very patient and helpful.

I've been here a few times and every time we have received horrible service! Today we were seated quickly but we sat here for 20 mins before anyone came to great U.S. Or take our drink order.... Then when we finally saw our waitress she took our orders and we didn't see her again. The manager was making his rounds and asked us if we wanted more chips for our appetizer that had come to the table 20 mins prior and I said no because now it cold. He did offer us another but at this point I'm already irritated. I would be a little more forgiving if they were slammed but they weren't at all. I mean there were only 10 tables with people! Anyway... I was not impressed. I probably won't be going back since this isn't the first time this has happened. They need better staff and better managers!

I am amending my review to 4 stars.  Tony went out of his way to make sure we had an excellent experience. His was attentive and quick. The wait is over 30 minutes.  They entire outside is empty. Won't seat anyone outside because they "want you to have the best experience and servers might forget you are outside "...REALLY?!

Love this location. The food is always delicious and we have our favorite waiter Jose Luis. He is the most hardworking Person in that place. He makes our experience so much better. So friendly, hardworking, and always has a great attitude! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because twice we got our food before our appetizers but it wasn't a big deal because the food just came out fast.

Used to love this place. Lots of new rules and charging extra for everything, as well as plates 1/3 the portion they used to be. Don't need to come back. Got a salad and it had a breast of chicken which was great, but only had like 3 beans and kernels of corn. And the plates used to overflow with lettuce and toppings and I thought they served us the wrong plate it was so small. Service? What waitress? Manager came to help us.

This is the perfect example of how a place can have great food but if they lack in customer service there reviews & ratings will suffer for it. The food here is great, I love the burgers here for the most part there all good I've tried a few, the one with the fried egg is my fav. The fries here are on point & the best part they have bottomless fries here which is awesome.
