There chips with the chipotle sauce is a very good appetizer as you wait for you're food & trust me you will wait for you're food. The kid options & shakes are good as well. The food always comes fresh & tasting good. Some of the best burgers I've eaten have been here. Yes I love the food here, so why don't I come here more often? Well the service is SLOW & SAD! Every time I've come here the wait is long & never really that busy so I don't get it. And you know what the wait isn't even the real problem here. I don't mind waiting a bit for good food as long as the service is good. Now don't get me wrong the service ain't bad but it ain't good either. Considering that they know the food takes awhile (cuz a lot of people complain about that here) you figure they be more on point.  For example the couple times we are there we had to wait awhile & as we did we finish our drinks & no one would come & check on us ever! We had to flag our waitress down & call them over cuz every-time they walked by us it's like they knew we needed something & they rush by us & not make eye contact with us, they did this with customers as well. We have waited 30 min with no refills & no food & no one asking us if we want more chips or apologies, that's unacceptable! We're not the only ones I've actually seen customers ask to speak to the manger, which I don't do cuz I try not to have tension with my waiter I want to eat peacefully but it's hard not to sometimes. The waitress here are not mean or rude but there not nice or friendly either there just like Blah. Some of them don't even look like they want to be working there, there just there to get a little check & pay there iPhone bill. People like that shouldn't be waitress & working serving people. Look I don't need red carpet attention or a hug when I walk in a restaurant I just want a refill on my drinks & a smile & just check on us & tell us why it's taking long & a apology that's it. I don't even know if it's the waitresses or cooks that's taking long but the manger needs to find out where the problem is cuz it's frustrating (I use to be a manger at a restaurant it's not that hard to find out what the problem is). Retrain or hire some new fast or at least happier workers. Or maybe you guys just need to have an extra 5 min breaks to just hug each other & practice smiling & drink a Red Bull. I don't know but you guys need to do something.  Like I said the food is good & that's why I will continue to come but everytime we decide we'll come here we take a deep breath & say "But damn the service is slow & sad" & sometimes we say oh well & come anyways cuz we love the food but almost everytime we come the service fails us. The food thank god makes up for it but only  enough for 3 stars. This place has potential to get 5 stars if the workers would be happier & a little faster & be more considerate. I wish I can give them more then 3 stars but I can't. Maybe one day I will but till then, come on Red Robin workers cheer up you have a job & we're hungry please be nice & a little faster I'll tip you big I promise.

Went here during lunch. It was a little under staffed, but we were seated quickly. Took about 10 minutes to get our drinks. Another 15 to get our food ordered. Some people that came in after us got their food already served, we felt like we weren't getting enough attention although we had flagged down 3 servers to take our order/refills/check. I was pretty disappointed with the service, it's usually decent but for some reason it's been dwindling down. It took a total of 2 hours of time at this restaurant, probably an hour was spent waiting. Red Robin, you either need more staff or better servers.
Went to eat early so the place was pretty empty, which is a good thing. Food came out fast and was pretty good. Waitress was very polite.

There seems to always be a wait here and parking is terrible!  I come here a lot with my friend and her kids.  You can make any burger vegetarian by substituting the patty.  I usually try to order a different burger when I go. I love how you can order more fries, unfortunately I can never pack in more than one serving.  Service is variable- sometimes not so good, sometimes okay and sometimes great.  It just depends I suppose on how busy the restaurant staff are.  The milkshakes are yummy but filling, hard to drink that and have a burger.  Overall food is okay and service is random.  Good luck! :)

I used to love this place but it sucks now. The burgers are pretty low quality considering how much you pay for them ($9-$14). The burger I had (banzai burger) honestly tasted like a Burger King whopper with canned pineapples. Not too pleasant. They do not, however, lack in customer service. They're pretty quick
Top notch burgers. Prepared just the way you like them. The Onion rings are some of the best around.

This place has really good food and drinks, but the service is lacking. I normally wouldn't post this if it was a one time thing, but there is some sort of a 'problem ' evert time we come here. Hardly any chili on the burger, people seated after us being served before is, and once the server never even put our order in! You have nice people working here, but there is some sort of a disconnect somewhere. The staff is always apologetic and tries to compensate, but as a customer, it's getting old that we have to say something everytime. There are a lot of other places to go eat and we don't come here as often as we used to. And that's a shame.

Ate there today... was excited that they  have this tablet that you can order youself and pay on the device... we tried the verry berry drink and oreo shake, that was good :) then our food came we ordered blue ribbon burger, medium rare. Meat was burnt at the bottom :( you can taste the bitterness of it, so that was not good. Waiting for our water and drinks to get refilled but we needed to get their attention before we got our refill. Then time to pay.... so we were excited to use the tablet but after swipping the card it said our check can't be processed right now. We tried it 3x still no go. We asked help with our server but still didnt work so we end up just paying the regular way. Food wasnt that bad just the burnt part... usually we dont get that but service was a little slow for sure.

I only come here because my wife and kids like it here but man...if it wasn't for the beer and the wings , yes the wings....I wouldn't come here. The game is on and the beer is cold...good enough for me but a "one star" for Red Robbin!

Melissa was our sever for lunch today and was an absolute delight! She was super friendly and on top of everything. She brought our food out in the expected time, didn't rush us, and made our experience a very positive one. Thank you!

This is the first time I have ever reviewed any business.  However the service and food was beyond terrible that I felt compelled to make my first review.  The hostess has to be one of the worst i have ever seen.  there were maybe 4 tables occupied and when I come in she leaves to the kitchen comes back a few minute latter to seat us.  Doesn't offer a greeting or even say hi and obviously looks like she hates her job and can careless about the customers coming in.  When we were eating it was impossible to get the waitress over to refill the drinks.  We saw her when we ordered then didn't see her again till we got our food.  If I didn't literally go to the kitchen and walk up to her we would of never have received service.  When the food came the toast that came with the clam chowder was burnt black and the burger was so cold the cheese didn't even melt.  I asked for another piece of toast since the first was not edible and  the waitress looked at me as if nothing was wrong with it.  All thing considered it is rare to go into a restaurant and receive both terrible service and food but they accomplished it very well.  Definitely lost me as a customer.

Our waitress sucked. She messed up my chilli cheese fries twice. ALL I WANTED WAS FOR THEM TO LEAVE OFF THE BACON. I understand it's hard for Bacon eaters to grasp the concept that not everyone eats Bacon, but I don't eat pork period. We only went to red robins because my husband had never ate there. Food was basic. Wont return to this location, because mall restaurants always suck. What was I thinking?

Red robin.... YUUUUM!  Came in for my FREE birthday burger and our service was great! Got seated quickly and our waitress was attentive making sure we were doing well.  I'm in love with the royal red robin burger because the fried egg makes it so much better! I've been here multiple times and haven't had any problems with the service or food.

our first time here. Huge menu, perfect burgers, and the prices aren't all that bad either,drinks were awesome our server(Maira B) was very sweet. Baes dosent always tip just because...he feels you need to earn it. Bbygirl tho got baes tip!! Thank you red robin! We will.definitely come back.

So we come here every once in a while...  This most recent trip was on a weekday for a late lunch, around 1pm.. It wasn't busy at all, seated right away at the booth of our choice..  Our server was friendly and checked on us often..  They have a pretty large menu, mostly burgers.. And they are very accommodating to substitutions and special requests...  Their onion ring tower is pretty popular. Thick cuts of onion, came out hot. Comes with 2 dipping sauces.  Their pretzel bites were pretty good. The cheese sauce was a touch too running, I'd like the cheese to stick a bit more, but it had a nice subtle beer taste to it.  I got the bonsai burger this time around.. The patty is a nice juicy size.. And I like the teriyaki taste.. I didn't care too much for the pineapple though, a personal preference.. Husband got their special Oktoberfest burger, I forgot the exact name.. But it has sausage and candied bacon on it.. Any burger with their candied bacon is a score.. These burgers are a decent size and come with "bottomless" steak fries which can also he substituted for a healthier choice.. But I stuck with the steak fries and requested it to be "extra crispy" and it was just that, super crispy on the outside, soft inside.  Kids got the corn dog bites with fruit. Nice crunch to the batter.  We got a mud pie for dessert to share. That thing is big enough for 4... Basically a super rich chocolate ice cream cake. Very indulgent.  Their milkshakes and speckled (strawberry) lemonade are also good choices...

I've been coming to red robin for over ten years and this is the first time the server was trying to charge $1.99 for fries to start off with. Guess it's not really bottomless anymore. There are many times I order their onion rings, burgers, salads, freckled lemonade, dessert, among other things that I was just craving some fries as a starter. So I was taken back when she told me of this cost. Goes against their advertising, I think. But anyway.. My current favorite salad is their fiesta salad. Their A1 peppercorn burger is also good. The fire burger is okay.  Their smoke and pepper tastes the best there.  Their wraps are disgusting.  Freckled lemonade is a must.  Milkshakes are always a win.  Onion rings are to die for.

First time at a red robin ever and it horrible. . First off walked in and a family with 3 babies and 3 women were in front of us. A woman (I'm assuming the hostess or a waitress) came up to the counter and didn't say anything but just stared at us. I had to say that the women with kids were there before us. She sat them and walked behind the line (where they prepare food ). My husband and I then stood at the door waiting to be seated for 5 minutes. MIND YOU THE RESTAURANT IS DAMN NEAR EMPTY. So I was pretty confused and pissed to see that we weren't being seated. My intentions were to leave then but my husband said let's just go sit at the bar. So we sit there and wait for another 5 minutes for a waitress to acknowledge us. She finally brings us menus and water. I don't know her name because she didn't introduce herself. We ordered pretty quickly and got our appetizer fast. I saw the manager walking around finally in her pink polka dotted shirt speaking to various tables but never came to ours. My burger was salty but still ok. I order the tavern double with grilled mushrooms. I'll come back when you guys decide that you want to have a proper hostess who will sit us since she clearly did see us or i'll just got to another location.

Hands down BEST place to eat for lunch! Burgers & Bottomless Fries...what more can u ask for!! Try the pomegranate margarita it's REALLY good. Love the servers in the bar area always have a Great positive attitude. :)

I had a great experience at this Red Robin in October 2015.  My guacamole bacon burger was delicious and who can complain with endless fries.  My girlfriend had a salad that she enjoyed and the sauce she had was good with the fries.  The bathrooms were clean and the service was fine.  It was interesting to use the tablet at the table to pay.  I will definitely return.

The Service: Upon walking in we were quickly greeted by the hottest. She was friendly but didn't really make eye contact, I found that a little strange. But she was young so.. So, no worries. She seated us and smiled and that's perfectly fine!  Our waitress, Mayra V (I guess there are two Mayras that work there?) was all smiles and very informative. She taught us how to use the electronic table menu and even helped us join the rewards program. She had quiet a few tables going but we never felt like she wasn't on top of things! She was great about keeping of drinks filled and clearing in wanted dishes. I'll be asking for her every time we come in! The Food: Sometimes I forget how great the food is here!  We ordered the Mushroom Chibata Burger, The Bdg Chibata Burger, the Chicken Nuggets, and the mini pretzels appetizer. Everyone enjoyed their food. I LOVED MY BDG BURGER. It was juicy and so flavorful. I also really enjoy their onion rings.  The Atmosphere: It was the typical Red Robin Restaurant. It was red, cute, and clean. The bathrooms were clean. The only thing I found off putting about my visit there was a gentleman server, at least he might have been. He was clearing dishes and walking in and out of the restaurants kitchen and back room in a black sleeveless tank top. Weird right? Like he might drop some sweat or armpit hair around. It was just off putting.  The overview: Hostess was nice Mayra V was fantastic, had she not been our server I might not be back due to sleeveless guy.  My burger was BOMB Black tank top guy needs to put a shirt on, I don't care how buff your arms are!
Jose the older gentlemen is very slow and will get ur order wrong nd tell u ur wrong, however the manager Ruben was very great made our terrible experience a little better thank u for that

Food quality has changed throughout the years. Presentation is poor, service is slow and lacking of flavor.  The decor has changed too. They used to have sports memorabilia all over the walls of this 2 floor restaurant and now it's completely bare with dark gray and deep colored walls. The wooden blinds are being held by tape. Yes... I said tape! Atmosphere wise, I just wanted to hurry up and get out of there. It's still busy because it is attached to Plaza Bonita mall and unless you want to eat Subway or Panda express from the mall food court, this is one of the few options. Our waitress Jasmyne was very nice and attentive.  I give her 5 stars but not Red Robin. If you want to eat at a sit-down restaurant and rest your arm from swiping your credit cards, go to Chili's instead.

Horrible!!!  How they can pass these burgers off as "gourmet" is beyond me!  Tasteless, and way overpriced.  The only thing I could taste was tomato and a cold stale bun.  The onion rings were good but overall was very disappointed.

2 years in a row I've come to this Red Robin for Veterans Day and the service is so awesome! The general manager Rene is very personable and interactive with customers. As a former service member, I appreciate the love and support they have for our military. :)

Crap service. Waited for a table for almost an hour and the employees kept saying it would only take 5 min. Service is slow and many people are kept waiting for just water. Very disappointed never coming back.

This Red Robin is close to home so we normally stop by for a burger. Last night we stopped by to take advantage of the free burger for veterans and active duty military personnel and to say the least it was SUPER BUSY. I won't fault them for it because providing free meals for military is very generous. Our server Marcella did a great job even though she was swamped. We both ordered the tavern double and two of the Not Your Father's Root Beer Floats and they were AMAZING! I was skeptical at first but that first sip changed my mind. The beer itself is 5.9% or something like that but they give you the rest of the bottle so you can refill it. My only complaint is that it's not bottomless! The burgers were good of course and fries were filling but the real winner for me is still the Jalapeño Coins in the pick 2 App deal. They aren't CRAZY spicy and just a little salty. The mozzarella sticks are good too. We are always full and happy when we leave here and that's what we go for. Also, they have these awesome little machines at the tables now where you can order desert, apps and drinks from and can also pay your bill so no waiting for your check. Overall they get a five stars from me. Keep doing you RR.
Was given a gift card for this place haven't been here in a while. Service was good the girl who was my server was really nice decent burgers decent price unlimited fries .

This place is pretty good if you're into burgers. They don't try to go too far away from burgers. But they're pretty good. Bottomless fries are hard to argue and they have good seasoned fries for just a little extra. But still Bottomless. Like less than 50 cents. Service is good. Food comes pretty quickly. Overall a pretty good experience. And now they have the tablets at the table so you can order and pay with minimal confrontation.

I'm giving 5 stars because the food was good and the bartender Lisa was awesome!  I felt good walking into the establishment, everyone greeted me with a smile and a good afternoon.  I can honestly not take anything for this chain restaurant.  I love it and again the bartender Lisa was awesome!!!

I should be treated very well at this place for how often I bring my family here, but unfortunately, everything is wildly inconsistent.  The really awesome waiter always recognizes me and the fam but he even had an off-day once.  We've had him probably 10 times as our waiter, though, and I have written a note to the manager more than once letting him know how good this waiter is.  The portions change, there are a couple servers who deserve the 30% tip, and there are a couple it pains me to give them 15%.  The manager is accommodating and admits the inconsistency.  The big problem, however, is the manager.  He doesn't want the cooks to make the food how customers want it, which is how they make it when they aren't being micro-managed by this guy.  I asked him about a salad that usually has a bunch of chicken on it that my wife, 5 year old, and I (used to) love to split as an appetizer.  This particular instance it only had 1/3, maybe a 1/2, as much chicken as usual.  The manager's explanation was that he regulated how much chicken goes on the salad with the cooks.  Thanks for ruining your restaurant for us, manager.  Don't count on seeing our $60-100 every week ever again, bro.  Sometimes it was 2-3 times in one week.

They were great. The hostess Isa was friendly and helpful. Food was good. I took a star off because I asked for ciabatta bread and they gave me a sesame bun. They offered to change it but I refused. Why waste food? They were busy early too.

If I could give this particular branch 0 stars, I would for zero concept of customer service, management, and organization. Been here twice now and on the first visit, our server had only talked to us twice--1st time was to check on our order and second was to give us our check. We got our entrees waaay before our appetizer, which came while we were halfway through our dinner. Second and even worse time, they quoted us 20-25mins for a table but actually got seated close to an hour later. And if that wasn't bad enough, it took 10 minutes (yes, we timed it after the horrendous wait time for the table) before a server actually paid any attention to us. And then, par for the course, said server went to check on us only twice yet again, just like the server on our first visit! She seemed more than happy to attend to the other tables except the two on our side. Thank God they've got those Ziosks on every table now, otherwise I shudder to think how long it's going to take them to give us our check and how long to get our card back. I got a very stale, spiritless mojito and my husband barely got any strawberries in his freckled strawberry lemonade, even in the refills! Needless to say, we are NEVER going to give this particular Red Robin another chance!

I have been to other Red Robin restaurants in the past and this place did not disappoint! I walked in, walked over to the bar, placed my take out order, and within a short amount of time, the food was ready.  When I got home, it was still warm and my wife and I had a nice dinner.  It seemed as if they skimped a little on the french fries on my take out order so I had to take off one star for that. Thanks Red Robin for the December birthday burger and for the quick service!  We will be back.

been here a few times to make use of the bottomless fries! sweet potato of course. that wasn't the issue tonight. waiter asked how i want my burger done, i say medium rare. what do i get? a dry, beyond well done, crispy, ruined slice of ground beef I've ever had. I've always ordered mine medium rare and it would always come medium at times, which is fine. but tonight, that pretty much ruined my dinner. char broiled? more like char burnt.

This Red Robin is alright. I've been here a few times since my aunt likes their food. The food is average to me and the service is sometimes a bit shakey. Once when we came here though there was a hair in my sisters salad. They changed it out and apologized but I kind of thought they would give us a free dessert or maybe a discount since my sis had to wait for a new salad but they didn't offer. Which they don't have to just thought it would be a nice courtesy. During that visit I also tried the garlic fries because I'm an avid fan of garlic fries but they didn't have the taste I was expecting. Guess I thought there would be more of a fresh garlic flavor, but it was more like a garlic powder flavor.  During my most recent visit yesterday although the staff was nice, the service wasn't great. I ordered a burger with onion but they never put the onions in. I had to ask for it. Then I ordered an onion ring appetizer which didnt come. When my entrees came out and still no onion rings I asked the waitress. We didnt get the onion rings til the end of our meal, by then I was actually about to cancel them until they were dropped of to the table. Maybe they regulate the onions back there.

What keeps me coming back here? Honestly, I love burgers and fries. My favorite burger is the Royal Red.  Order the onion rings, they're fantastic! The waiters are usually in need of an attitude adjustment. This one particular hostess is tops and super friendly.

I was hungry. A hamburger from red robin . Because the last time I was there ibsaid they were so delicious . But this hamburger. We both were delighted with our meals . Although she still wishes she got the sandwich she had . But she wanted to try something new . When got there We got seated pretty quickly . Our meals were both delicious . The service was great .. I highly recommend this place to anyone . You won't be sorry .

On this visit, we were meeting friends from out of town. My friend was visiting family in the South Bay Area and after wanted to see my wife and I for the new year in a casual setting. I have been to other Red Robin's before. The one in La Jolla and the other in Temecula. Both locations were pretty good in food and service. So at first I thought it was a great idea. Good food. Not too expensive. Quick bite to eat.....well, I was right on only one out of three.  The service was real slow. We were visited by different servers at different times but the time between visits were long. We even waited longer for our food. Total time dining was two and half hours. The only reason we stuck around was we haven't seen our friends in a while. They were also leaving San Diego after our meal.  The food was 'meh'. Even waiting for so long and starving. You would think they would serve me dog food and I would say that this was the best food ever. I didn't get that. Just disappointment. I left underwhelmed and no 'Yum'. Never going there again. This Red Robin is a pass.

Located right next to the fitness center Crunch, and outside of the food court. The longest we've waited for the table was 15minutes, not bad for a busy restaurant on the wkends. Our favorite drink is freckled strawberry lemonade, it comes in a cool looking glass cup. I'll prob get diabetes hahaha...I also love their unlimited french fries, it's always fresh. Yum. My all time favorite burger from Red Robin is their regular cheese burger, buffalo wings & onion rings. Tastes amazing but I always feel guilty after eating them haha.  Service was never a problem for me when I come here. Every waiter & waitresses that served us was all nice.

Let me start off by saying I really like the food at this place or I should say I use to. So we ended up going last night to grab a burger. We sat down and waited and waited for waitress. The poor girl seemed to have tables all over the place. While we are waiting we look around and the restaurant which was kind of dirty. Tables were left unclean all over the place. It Should have been a sign.  We order the buzz wings as an appetizer to share. Two burgers and drinks. Wings were burned and didn't not taste very good. We had to ask for ranch to help them get some taste. Very disappointed. Burgers were so dry and the buns were too toasts they were burned. We did not finish the burgers. Fries were not great either. Our dinner was a flop. Stay away from this red robin and maybe try another one. Hire more staff and train your cooks better.

Health Dept Warning. I was fed a severely undercooked Marco Pollo sandwich. as in the center of the breast was completely raw. I've called corporate. and Will be calling the heath dept. about this. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE PEOPLE

If I can give this place ZERO stars I would. When we first got there we waited maybe 10 mins. That was the only good thing. Then the real waiting began. Our server took our drink orders quick as our food order. I ordered a basic magarita. Never again. It was watered down, not tastful at all. So I just asked for a coke. Can't mess that up. So we wait and wait and wait. We waited 40-45 mins! Why we waited I dont know. Our server passed us so many times with no acknowledgment what so ever. I was very disappointed in this place. The food was not even good, or hot for that matter. The service was horrible, as the food. We will never go back to this location again. Spare your time and go elsewhere.

Mediocre food that has dipped below what I remembered them to be. Went here expecting to have an awesome burger with bottomless fries. Instead I got a really sucky burger and bottoms less fries of one variety. They used to let you change the option as long as you paid the up charge. Our waiter seemed more interested in closing as soon as the hours hit for closing then to ask us for things and water before we asked. Hope you liked your $2 tip. Stick to In n Out. That's it.

Let's get something straight: This is not a 5-star Michelin rated restaurant by any means, it is just Red Robin. And the "Chefs" here are actually just a bunch of kids barely out of high school .  BUT(big butt), the food is inexpensive and tends to hit the spot for me, which is why I keep coming back.  Fresh food, bottomless fries and drink, quick service, and convenience of location is why you should come here, not for the best meal you've ever had in your life.   Having settled that, here are my recommendations(in no particular order): 1)Red's Double Tavern Burger 2)Crispy Chicken Sandwich 3)Blue Ribbon Burger 4)Royal Red Robin Burger 5)Whisky BBQ River Burger 6)Clucks and Fries Make sure you get some Honey Mustard on the side for dipping your fries and clucks in.  Seriously, that ish is liquid gold. Peace.

If you're looking for a great burger, you should instead go to Eureka, which is about 50 yards away from Red Robin in the same outdoor mall. Eureka has much better quality burgers for the same (or slightly cheaper) prices. Also, Eureka has much more tasteful and mature atmosphere. Red Robin would probably be better for a family with kids.  They won't cook any burgers less than medium at Red Robin, which is unfortunate, because I prefer medium rare.  The atmosphere at Red Robin is very casual and playful. It's probably great for families with kids. They have iPads (or equivalent tablets) at each table for paying the bill and playing games during your meal. I find the iPads fairly distracting, but depending on the type of group you're with, the iPads could be fun.  I haven't tried them, but Red Robin definitely has some substantial milk shakes and root beer floats.  If I remember correctly, there's a bar inside.

Bottomless drinks and fries, and good service. A little pricey depending on what you get, but good food. I had the about-Cobb-o salad. SOO GOOD! And light too! It filled me up for the rest of the day. Highly recommend!!

Having a birthday dinner at the Red Robin and I was sadly disappointed yet again. Others in my party wish to go to the Red Robin for their birthday. It was further confirmation of I The food is mediocre to poor as demonstrated with the broccoli picture. If it wasn't for the bottomless fries and the free birthday burger I wouldn't have gone to the birthday. The store manager did do his best to rectify the food presented at our table but it had ruined the evening.  The more aggravating is the kitchen knew what they were serving. Because the broccoli was turned in such a manner that they were hiding the defects of the food.

Went to eat lunch, the hostess was friendly and had menus ready as soon as we stepped inside. Our waitress was very friendly and polite. She had another guy shadowing her, and he too was very polite. They gave us recommendations and chatted as we tried to make up our mind about what to order. Both checked on us made sure were okay and if we needed anything. They both provided some of the BEST customer service we've received in a long time. Our food came out promptly, and it was very good. We ordered burgers, they were medium well done and delicious. I'd recommend to come in as soon as they open so you don't have to wait long.

Honestly i hate going to places where you pay $15 on a burger, and this is just the place. In and out is way better in terms of taste and price. First of all they don't even have sweetened tea and sorry but what kind of restaurant doesn't have sweet tea. I ordered a whiskey river bbq burger as it was a "red robin favorite" and there was literally no bbq sauce on it, the onion strips were SO salty my throat started to hurt, the meat wasn't even that great, there was old wimpy small strips of lettuce, and sad cheap looking buns. My friend next to me ordered a bowl of clam chowder and there was an eyelash on the inside of her bowl. Gross. My dad ended up paying $115 on a few burgers and fries that didn't even taste that great. Sorry but I'm never coming back here.

The burgers here are just too good to pass up, and you can't go wrong with bottomless fries and their house dip. The Southern Charm Burger is sooo good! My favorite. Close second is the Whiskey River BBQ wrap. They also have a lot of beer and alcohol options. Red Robin Royalty members get a free burger during their birthday month!  Whenever we go, we usually try to ask for Mymy to be our server. She's very attentive and helpful, and honestly makes the experience a lot more easy and fun! All of her recommendations have been delicious!! Really appreciate her customer service.

This place has been around forever. I love burgers just as the next guy but I have to say I don't know why I waited so long to try them out. Not only are the burgers good (as any burger should be) but what makes this particular burger place different is that it's also satisfying. I don't get full on a single burger and like most guys, we consume a lot to get full (from my experience) but upon my second visit I have to admit.I'm FULL! I don't recommend the house margaritas, go for the adult version - they are tasty. Thumps up.

Red Robin is one of our fave go to burger spot in SD. In this location they're at Plaza Bonita mall in National city.  We love the variety of their gourmet burgers, yummy appetizers (hmmm mouthwatering towering onion rings !) and entrees.  Fave salad is the Insane Romaine Salad hmm my foodie crush. It was insanely delicious! Grilled salad and grilled chicken ! Nom nom nom kind of healthy. Must order!!! Good portion.  Kiddos love their milkshakes and freckled lemonades. Bottomless beverage ! Can't beat that ! They also have soups,wraps and Sammies !  And French fries are endless and tasty !  Love their craft beers and cocktails.  You gotta try the new ginger ale beer with 5.9 alcohol it was delish ! Sweet taste! Overall, great vibes! Nice decor. Good CS. Can't complain !  Coming back soon to try the red ramen burger ! Only for a limited time ! I'm curious let's try it !  Oh my! I'm hungry now lol,  Highly recommended !!! Yum!

My boyfriend and I always go here and we always always get the Mudpie for sure!!!! And the Hamburgers are so yummy! The ghost hamburger is the best one and the bottomless fries are the best ones! It's worth it to include the Parmesan cheese! Love going there!
Horrible service and my plate and silverware where dirty!! The only good thing was the beer!!

You can get all the fries you want with your burger!! Garlic fries yes!!! This is the place where I fell in love with reds apple ale!! It all started here! And I thank them because it's hard for me to find a great ale beer! This place does get crazy but it's slow on Mondays and Tuesday's.  The food here is good and the staff is nice

The service at this location is good. They usually have a wait but it's worth it. The servers are nice and attentive most of the time. It's a little pricy but the food is delicious. The burgers are always well done and delicious. The appetizers are pricy for the quantity but delicious and the drinks are good too. They have Tv's and if you seat at the bar or around the bar you can enjoy the games.

I decided to come here for my birthday because I'm signed up for the royalty program that comes with a free burger. I ended up sitting at the bar where the server was very polite and fast. He immediately asked if I wanted anything to drink and provided a menu. I ordered a lemonade and a royal red robin burger, (the one with the egg on top). The bartender was quick with refills and was very helpful. The burger itself was very well done and juicy. I chose garlic fries, which were delicious.  I would highly recommend coming here. The food was great and the service was on par.

Been here multiple times and the only thing really worth getting is the tavern double with fries and the onion rings. The 3 gourmet burgers I've tried really had no taste unless you smothered it with bbq sauce.  Today we had Melissa as a waitress and she was super pleasant. Definitely the best customer service we've ever had at this location.

Great friends, great evening.   Highlight:  We ran out of fries and out of no where Miguel is at our table with hot and fresh fries.  He wasn't even our server.  Great service Miguel! Lowlight:  The side caesar salad.  Why bring the entire head of romaine lettuce?  On the tiniest of plates?  Dressing drizzled on top?  No silverware?  I get artistic, so it had eye appeal, but we wanted to eat it!  It was ackward, and unappealing.  Salads should be preassembled.

I came in the other night with my boyfriend for dinner and after I sat down, our server named Alia greeted us... Then asked us if we wanted something to drink. I asked for a Dr. Pepper &' when I got my drink it was by accident a Rootbeer and I asked another server for a Dr. Pepper she came by and politely apologized. Then got me a refill and said "I promise it's Dr. Pepper." So as a joke I told her "oh this is Rootbeer!" She looked surprised and said "no way i swear it was Dr Pepper." I just loved how easily she was able to get along with and her personality was so energetic. She's an awesome server !

I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet burger with a fried egg. It was very delicious!  What was even better than the food today though was the service we got. I called ahead and showed up earlier than I expected and our table was ready. We were seated immediately. Our server Maricela was by far the best server I've ever had. She asked for our drink order and kept them coming before we even needed to ask for refills. She was amazing. I'll definitely be coming back to this location.

Went there on an hour lunch with several co-workers. Sat and ordered quickly at the empty bar. 30 minute wait for burgers and fries! No warning. No time to eat so we had to box it and go. So much for the bottomless fries. I'll never do that again.:(
This place is gross, the tap water tasted disgusting. The seafood scatter was horrible. Never coming back here.

Doesn't matter if I'm eating in or dinning out, this RB is always friendly!! Great customer service and quick service! Greatly appreciated!! Shoutout to James and Mimi for having great customer service and for being amazing friendly!!

We have been to this location several times. And never have I encountered such rude and terrible service. So bad that we left. We signed in yesterday around 6:45pm they told us the wait would be 20-30 mins for 2 adults and a baby, and yes we asked for a high chair since we weren't allowed to bring our stroller in. Both girls at the front were rude several times. They did keep apologizing about the wait but not until we had been waiting 45 mins did they decide to tell us they had a party of 25 and Thats why the wait was so long. That and the fact that they couldn't find a table for a high chair. What place doesn't accommodate havin a child with them?? My husband and I felt very frustrated and to be honest the girls up front made us feel as if having our baby with us was our fault and the reason for the long wait. Manager was nowhere around. We left upset, hungry and with a cranky baby. We could have had her in her stroller that whole time we were waiting. But no, we couldn't bring the stroller in with us. Very appalled by the terrible service, not being seated, terribly long wait, and the extreme rudeness of the employees here. We have always loved this restaurant but we will not be going back and will be telling all of our family and friends about this. And we will be Sharing this post with the public as well. Very disappointed.

Worst hostess service ever. Wait time was 30min, then another 15min, then another 15min, 1hr 30min for sit down. Inside the eating area was half empty and people who arrived after me were sent down before me. I was given a table for 4 when we were a party for 5. Don't recommend

Definitely came thru when needed!! Diana and her crew got us in out when we were going to see a movie!! Great food and great service!! The ONLY place to go before seeing a movie!! Love the "bottomless fries"...

I would have to say they are my favorite when it comes to burger and desserts. I also tried the soups and I would not recommend it. The chicken Tortilla and clam chowder is way too thick and does not taste as good! I do like the red sangria  The servers are very pleasant and attentive and i did not have to wait for my order very long.  I would definitely come back here but not for the soup. MY Son loves the games that they offer although you have to pay 1.99 and unlimited use until you pay your bill then it will also stop the game :)
Jane was absolutely the waitress. When was friendly and she was very kind to our kids. The burgers were very good.
The hostess told me that I was going  to wait 10- 15 minutes , after 30 she didn't text me ... Of course I left. Customer service sucks !

AWFUL! !!THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN...We ordered  3 burgers & asked for well done ,Wich our waitress did not make a note of on her ticket.They all came out way undercooked & one of them literally had drops of blood...The tables were So sticky we had to wipe down ourselves. ..We left without eating ,but still payed the bill because of drinks & one kids meal.We dont have much money & havnt been out in months & to get this type of service was heartbreaking to say the least....WARNING DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION! !!!!

My friend and I came here for lunch last week. Hadn't been to RR in a long time, and I forgot how great their burgers were. But I'm writing this review because of this location's outstanding customer service. The wrong order was put in for my meal- no big deal right? I didn't even complain, but the staff immediately informed me my meal would be on the house and they had the right order out within less than ten mins. I was in shock, but grateful for their hospitality. We actually were given a new server when this happened- I hope he knows we weren't upset. Mistakes happen and it's only food. But thank you to the staff for going above and beyond both with comping my meal and from everyone from hostesses to servers being genuinely friendly. Will definitely be returning in the future. :)

The burgers are delicious. I haven't had one I haven't liked. The  royal red robbin burger is superb if you like yolk in your burger. The fries are the best..the staff here isn't always the best but it hasn't been too bad where I won't go back.

Great food, decent prices, i really like how they offer lettuce instead of buns for burgers.  Their beer selection is limited,  didnt hear of any "happy hour" specials but overall a cool spot, i would definitely go again.

Every Sunday my family and I eat out for lunch but it's a struggle to find a place that is good and accommodates a large party. Today we ate at Red Robin. Rene the manager was so nice and helpful when I called ahead to let me know we were coming. Upon arrival I asked if it would be okay to add 1 more person to the party and yes with a smile. We were seated as soon as everyone arrived. The food was great, our server was nice, quick and efficient. Can't wait to come back!

My family and I ate here this afternoon. The front of the house service was very slow. We knew we were attending during a peak time in the afternoon, but there were only a few sections open (poor planning house manager). The 15 minute wait we were told about became more like 35 minutes.  The food was a disappointment. The burgers were not cooked to our liking, the fries were cold, and everything was overpriced and not as good as we remembered.  My suggestion: have more staff scheduled before 3:00.  We decided we will be going to Five Guys instead next time.
Excellent service and food is good...great for kids! The servers keep the drinks coming and who doesn't love bottomless fries!!

another long lunch break and my work crew returned here...i ordered the same thing as last time...cobb salad... it was tasty...chicken was cooked nice and had a good flavor. my only complaint is that it was on a small plate vs the giant bowl...no room to move the salad around (mix up the toppings)...everything just kept falling off the plate.  service was nice parking is easy
Food is good. Garlic fries are super yummy. The manager there was an idiot and kept trying to tell my mom her order was right when it clearly wasn't. So three stars.

This is a good thing. I don't give my 4th star out to lightly however this was a good Burgers and fries. Now I don't expect much form a burger joint however this one surprised me. 1st they had gluten free buns and the meat can as I liked it red. I was thinking they would over cook it but the cook did not over cook it. Ya ya.   Now as for the fries they were not over cooked that was a surprise as well and they were not bad tasting as well. The services this is always tricky one because some are good and bad now I did notes that they don't like to answer you when you call. I seen the manger walk by and he did not answer keep walking though that was odd then he came up a little later and ask how it was going. Ok that is just stupid. Now our waitress was grate and she even though the others waitress would not answer us but there was one that would other then our waitress was a good waitress that was nice of her.&??

The service was good and the atmosphere was actually pretty cool. The food is usually really good but this time around the bacon was kind of hard. The rest of the hamburgers we had were actually amazing. I would more than likely go back.

Absolutely horrible, if I could give them no stars I would. We went for my birthday last night a point which we brought up to our server. She ignored that, that's fine. We ordered drinks; a root beer float, that was half empty and a Margarita, that was almost all sugar syrup. The burgers were disgusting, falling apart all over the plate with the driest meat you've ever tasted and gross wilted lettuce. And the service was also horrendous. We had two waitresses both of whom were lazy and inattentive. They just kept bringing out plates and glasses with out ever taking any away, at one point we had six empty dirty plates and five empty dirty glasses on our table. Absolutely terrible.  In short, you'll get a better meal from a fast food joint. The food here sucks, and the staff is unbelievably LAZY. Never ever again. Go literally anywhere else. I feel it necessary to point the out that we spent $104 on our bill. With no tip because they didn't deserve it.

If I could give zero stars I would but This was by far the worst restaurant experience we've ever had. First we were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait for a party of 2, understandable it was a Friday and it seemed pretty busy. They asked us for a phone number and told us they would text when our table was ready. There were no seats inside so we just sat outside to wait. 30 minutes go by still no seat, 45 minutes still no seat, an hour goes by still no seat so I go in to check how much longer the wait is. I ask the hostess she looks through the list and she says that it doesn't look like my name is on the list. She said that her manager reset the list and that we weren't the first ones to come up saying the didn't get sat. She then went to get her manager but when she came back she said that they didn't want to come up and that she's sorry that it's gonna be another 15 minutes. As I'm walking out of the door the manager came out and then asked me what happen then sat us after a few minutes. He took our drink order, we got a freckled lemonade and a raspberry limeade. Our actual waitress brought out our drinks then took our food order and we ordered the Nacho.m.g for an appetizer, I got the buzz Mac n cheese burger cooked medium well , and my girlfriend got the a1 burger cooked well done. So the nachos come out first and a different girl brought out our food. By this time I was done with my first drink and I set the empty glass at the edge of the table. The nachos had barely any cheese at all and the little cheese it did have was all in the middle and was microwaved too long. Shortly after the nachos came the same girl that brought out our nachos brought out our burgers. My girlfriend takes a bite out of her burger and it was the complete opposite of well done and mine, when asked for medium well, was extra well done. For me it wasn't a big deal I still could eat mine but for hers it was unacceptable so we press the call server button on the table. We wait about 10-15 minutes again for her to just come up to our table. Now again she didn't bring out our food just took our order and this is 10-15 minutes after we've already started eating and this server never once came to check on us or ask if our food is tasting okay. We ask if she can bring it back to make it well done she takes it and they make a whole new burger. Now by the time we get a new burger my girlfriend has already finished her drink and she drinks extremely slow. When they bring out the new burger a new person brings it out, sets it on the table and walks away without saying anything. This burger was cooked fine so we continue to eat but, still have no refills on drinks, no water and also no napkins. Now I could probably wave my hand and ask for a refill but I feel I shouldn't have to especially if my server has ignored us literally the entire time and she even walked past our table multiple times and looked over at our table. So it's getting close to the end and my girlfriend wanted to take the rest of her food home. So we hit the call server button again and this time we wait another 10 minutes for her to come to the table so we ask for a box. We watch our server go back and fourth with a table next to us and also receive boxes and refills. Another 10-15 minutes go by and by this point I got the attention of the guy that sat us in the beginning and let him know what else had happen. It only took him a couple minutes to get us a box and he also gave us a 25 dollar gift card because I had already paid while waiting for the box and we just wanted to leave. I've served for many years in the past and this girl should definitely find a new job. We won't ever be coming back to this location for red robin. It was our first and last.
Food was great. Service was sub par. This place is great for groups as evident in the numerous birthday celebrations occurring simultaneously.

I was pretty disappointed in this establishment. The service was extremely slow and our waitress although very nice was very young and lacked the professional demeanor and knowledge that I've come to expect at any restaurant. I love eating out and love trying new places and am usually able to give second chances if the first time was not satisfactory. But the food tasted like a dried out McDonald's meal. And to have to wait 20 minutes for a drink and then another 20 minutes for fries is just ridiculous. Me and my family went on a Monday night and the place was not busy and there was an abundance of waiters and waitresses as well as the Manager standing around. Will not be going back to this location.

Well then...  After celebrating 70 years of Spartan Pride and Homecoming the class of 78 CVHS decided to swing by the Bonita Red Robin. For burgers and cocktails. We were assigned Sammy.  When we found out she was 2 weeks into employ we thought that serving 10 fired up Spartans with high expectations would break her.... but no! She hung with the big dogs and came out shinning. Only one plate came out incorrect from the kitchen. She smartly gave the choice of keeping the plate but attentively was on the ready to replace... We were well taken care of and.... How happy am I that they had Belching Beaver on tap and 3 menu items at $6.99. I can say it won't take us as long to go back and Sammy is a keeper. Very personable. Our Friday night would have been a 5 star had the kitchen had put the onions on the side and gotten all the orders correct.  Good for you Bonita Plaza Red Robin. Did I mention I went over to the bartender to thank her for having BB peanut butter beer. Yay!!!!

The la jolla location is way better   This location in chula vista in plaza bonita mall takes forever to seat you even if there isn't many customers in the resturant. We have been here about 15 times and regret coming here every time. It also takes forever for the waitress to take your order. This particular visit today the waitress brought me water and as I proceeded to tell her I'd like to put my kids order in first she walked away without letting me finish my sentence and didn't come back to take my order for 10 minutes and at that time both my kids were screaming

I don't know why this place has such a low star count. I have had really great service here, our server was also the bartender and he was so nice! I had a pins colada and it was boozy and sweet! Plus the price for the drinks are so affordable!  The burgers are really yummy and inexpensive as well! Sign up for their rewards program you'll get a free burger on your birthday and discounts throughout the year!  Don't say I didn't tell you! Give em a chance and I'm sure you'll enjoy it!

Bee's knees waffle chicken burger was delicious. Garlic fries really good. Wait time was the only thing. Had to wait 22 minutes. And fry portion could be bit more.  Jheeze hook it up with the fries. And don't count on the machine at the edge of the table. Waiter took a minute to serve.  Besides that pretty Dam good.

Sat at the bar on a busy Friday night! The bartenders were SO friendly and helpful. I really liked the appetizer boneless wings and the California Chicken Sandwich. The bartenders were so attentive, never had an empty glass and they were always generous to offer a refill on the bottomless fries whenever it got a little low.

Service and food has improved since I wrote the original review.  We have an outstanding service while manager Rene is on duty, but not as good when he is not around.  We love their burgers and fries and hope that they continue to improve.

I've never been to Red Robin and I probably would never go again if it wasn't for Rene the manager. My guest and I sat and asked 3 different servers 3 different times for a fork because my guest ordered a salad. I'm in the hospitality business and I understand things are forgotten and get busy, but this was ridiculous. Honestly if it weren't for Rene the manager, I'd give 1 star. He fixed the problem with an apology and a brief discussion and I was very satisfied with his demeanor and professionalism. Kudos to Red Robin for hiring people like Rene and putting them in managerial positions.  bc

I visited Red Robin's today for lunch. I walk through the door and instantly got annoyed my sister and I weren't greeted at all just asked us to follow. Now that we're seated our waitress by the name of Rainee comes over she takes our order and leaves next time we seen her was when our cold food came out! I asked for our fries to be replace because they've seemed to have been sitting for quit a bit. Long story short.........her customer service was the worst I probably would never eat here again. I asked for well done burger and it came out pink

Took my son to Red Robin today. It was busy in the afternoon. The hostess took my name and placed me on a short wait on her iPad. She quits me 10 minutes to wait but texted me in 5 minutes to say out table was ready. The Manager on Duty took us to our table and was very pleasant. Our server was Melissa and she was outstanding. She gave us great service thank you Melissa. Our Royal Burgers were prepared perfectly and the fries were hot.  All in All a great dining experience.  Although all bartenders are amazing - Jazmin Mimi and Tony the food is never correct Waited for hot fries burger with onion which I ordered and my drink which I never got Renee Gm you should be ashamed of yourself I'm over this place
Onion rings are the boom !  Was their for lunch today and I always go back and try new things but fish n chips were cooked perfect!!!!  Clam chowder was also a very good!!!! Hats off to cooks

I wanted to celebrate my birthday here with my family bc this place has the best food and great customer service. Vanessa was our severe she was really nice and very helpful great customer service! Thank you Vanessa!

We have not been to a Red Robin in quite awhile. This one has moved the bar up on what we had expected. Maintains the somewhat garrish Red Robin color combination and the service was good and food was creative - especially the beverage menu for beers and cocktails. We had a nicely done set of burgers (you can create). If you are willing to give corporate restaurants a fair chance, this one is worth it.
Awesome,  very healthy Menu and friendly people.. food on time , place Super busy and very helpful...

We checked in and we were told that there was going to be a 30 minute estimate wait so we decided to go look at the stores. We got a message saying our approximate wait , so all we needed to do was wait for the message alerting us that our table was ready. 30 minutes passed and we never got a text message so we decided to go back regardless. Once we got there, the lady in the front asked for our name and we told her we never got the text. So she put this face saying "sorry we removed your name because you took to long." We mentioned how we never got a text message so she said "oh well you should've gotten one." Well we didn't, we had to wait a couple more minutes to get seated. We were highly disappointed. Food was great so this gets a three star. Plus good customer service by the waitress.

It was a rainy busy night, so we understood the wait time  to get a table. Wasn't a problem! Once we got a table , it was yucky dirty, like try a lil harder to wipe off the crud?  Our waiter was super busy, understood and could see it oozing outta the poor dude, but when he got to the table no hi hello, welcome - Nada, a what do you want for drinks? No Ok cool , thanks after we gave him the drink order- kinda odd and not personable in the slightest.  It took another 15 minutes for him to circle back for us to order our meals and when he did, I sh*t you not - He said - What do you want, Do you even know what you want yet? Haha, whoa bro, I feel ya on that tuff night for you, but step it up a bit. On to the meals - Mediocre at best. I asked for no lettuce, shredded lettuce to me is gross and it was covered in the stringy gross'ness. ok I can get passed that lil thing, but my boyfriends grilled cheese, was only grilled on one side and wasn't a gooey cheesy yummy filled sandwich. It was a half assed hard funky nasty cheese mess. Grandmas cup of soup wasn't even luke warm, was cold - granted she didn't care, come on man- leave it under that heat lamp a lil longer to at least let the cheese on top melt somewhat!
