It just seemed like they could careless. So well, we could careless about your restaurant.  Oh and PS By The Way - the only reason I left you a good tip, was because of the mess my kid made on the floor and I should of just gave that money right on over to your busser - who was much more gracious than said lame-o server  The End.
Foods great, fast service, consistent, endless steak fries are killer  my kids love it and request it often... if you come here get a damn burger!!!

the food is good. the burger that i got was seriously melt in your mouth. i put 4 star because i think the server forgot about us and took forever to bring our food. she did apologize for taking long. she mentioned someone took my order on accident. but overall she was great very friendly.

Consistency, quality and personablity describe this Red Robin. The staff here is vetted by management, trust me I've been coming to this one for years, the staff that doesn't have the manners, courtesy, etc... are often short lived here.

Walked in on a Friday night (family of 5) at 10pm (close at 11pm)  Got seated quickly and very politely. Food was great and service was on point. The wife's burger was missing the bleu cheese that came with it but they were quick to correct the issue after bringing it to their attention.  Would definitely go back based on the service we received. Red Robin...Yum!

I give this place two stars solely because the server was very kind and attentive. If not for her, it absolutely deserved one after today.  I do enjoy lettuce and tomato but for some reason I don't like them in my burger, specifically. I asked the server to make sure they don't include it and she acknowledged. When I got my Burger, I opened it to add some seasoning to it and found tomato and lettuce remnants in it. I picked it out and ate my Burger but it definitely tasted the heck out of what I didn't want in there, in there.  It comes down to laziness. They made the burger and noticed it's not the way I ordered it, and rather than saying "we screwed up. Let's start over," they instead say "oh crap. That wasn't supposed to be in there.... eh, just scrape the top bun and see if they notice." It's fortunate with laziness like that that it wasn't an allergy issue because that could have been SERIOUSLY problematic for somebody. There is no reason any cook should prioritize their disinterest in doing their job over again (especially when they are paid by the hour, not the burger) over providing their guests with the great tasting experience they asked for and paid for. He not only robbed me of that satisfied experience, he also robbed me of the opportunity to brag on this about what a good job he (could have) did.  I tipped the waitress well anyway because again she wasn't the issue by any means. The scrapped food was an indication that the error was in fact not on her. But consider my gears grinded with Red Robin.

When I came here last weekend it was pretty crowded and we had to wait about 15 to 20 minutes to be seated, but I will admit I did like the food way more than I thought I would. I had the "bees knees" chicken sandwich and it was delicious even when I ate half of it as leftovers when I got home.

We had a keto friendly burger (takeaway) , called fat pig burger or something. The Cole slaw was nice and spicey with mustard seeds. But we had some fierce diarrhea within the next hours after. So I won't get it again any time soon.

Went here for lunch I had the a1 steakhouse burger was delicious nice beef patty good onion roll the veggies were fresh and high quality we also got a mushroom swiss burger it was also very good but maybe too much mushrooms the fries were average service was great the server came by many times I'll definitely go here again.

If you know Red Robin, then you know about the bottomless fries and Freckled Lemonades. I've never had anything I didn't like on the menu, but tend to lean on my regular order: A1 Peppercorn Burger, no tomato, garlic fries.  This particular visit I had a great server who made sure we were tended to often, and mindful of a movie we were going to see at AMC. She even brought out the second wave of garlic fries so my friend could indulge. I was impressed.. and that's uncommon. All in all, this staff has always been super friendly and prompt!

I went to this Red Robbins with some friends before prom. They said it would take 30min to seat us ,but we were not seated after 30min or 10 min after that like they instructed or ten minutes after the first then minutes. We waited to be seated for 1hr 20min we ended up not eating because thw wait was so much. I was so disapointed and such a special night and we could not be seated

For the first time, I sat at the bar (not just the bar area, but the actual bar) because it was super busy and packed, but there was availability at the bar. Oh my goodness! Now I know where to sit. So much attention from the bartender/server (Mymy I think was her name). We got our food out promptly even though she warned us the wait from the kitchen was reaching 30-40 min. Because the wait time was so long for the food, she made sure to get the bottomless steak fries to us as soon as possible and frequently. High quality service! Such a rare experience from all the times that I've eaten at Red Robin.
Great burgers, great selection other than burgers, great service and prices!  What else can make your experience any better? Great job Red Robin!

I never have to worry about getting a good burger when I visit this location, but today I got my order and the burger was cold enough that the cheese on top wasn't even melted.......just when I decided to just not bother to eat it a manager walked up to me and asked if he could make me another burger....I hesitated because I really hate to complain....he fixed the problem with wonderful customer service. Made my day.... thank you sir in the red shirt that came from the back......wish I would have gotten your name

THIS HAS BEEN THE WORST RED ROBIN EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD! 20mins to even be acknowledged for drinks! As the manager mad dogged cause I was getting pissed! Whole meal was wrong! 20 mins to be checked out! Screw that place

I have been coming here for years. I have been to several different locations and the food is always great. I always order the fried mushrooms appetizer. The whiskey chicken burger is delicious and the best part is the bottomless fries. The employees and managers are friendly.

The Burning Love burger is by far the best burger I've ever had!!! Red Robin's service, drinks, and food selection give other burger joints a run for their money. Their endless fat fries and fried jalapeño coins always has me coming back for more!

This is a good thing. I don't give my 4th star out to lightly however this was a good Burgers and fries. Now I don't expect much form a burger joint however this one surprised me. 1st they had gluten free buns and the meat can as I liked it red. I was thinking they would over cook it but the cook did not over cook it. Ya ya.   Now as for the fries they were not over cooked that was a surprise as well and they were not bad tasting as well. The services this is always tricky one because some are good and bad now I did notes that they don't like to answer you when you call. I seen the manger walk by and he did not answer keep walking though that was odd then he came up a little later and ask how it was going. Ok that is just stupid. Now our waitress was grate and she even though the others waitress would not answer us but there was one that would other then our waitress was a good waitress that was nice of her.&??

My review hasn't changed much after the second visit. We went in and were greeted and seated as one would expect to be. I forget what it's called, but I had the one with the jalapeño pepper on top with fried pepper rings inside. I enjoyed it gluten free with an extra burger pattie.
This place is a love hate it could be a miss or a hit... the last time i came here the food quality was not worth the money at all i dont think i will be back

Outstanding service!! Food was great I had the burning love burger.  Very well round flavor. Buns well buttered and soft. Burger itself was cook perfectly. Waiter Jose was very attentive. By service alone, 5 stars. Both waiter and manager were at the minimum note worthy. I am huge on service. The experience is as important as the food.  Great food, great atmosphere and most of all great service.

We made a reservation for 11 to celebrate my mom's birthday. Our server Sammie made this experience a very pleasant one and everyone in our party was very content with her service. Sammie made sure at all times that we had our drinks filled and was very friendly. The food was great as well. My mom requested her food cooked a little more crisp as she likes and Sammie was very helpful and took the food back without making faces. Very great experience!

Me and my bf first time eating here and it was a nice customer service no wonder they always have a lot of people coming and coming ,we also got a small fries for free. Our servers name is Dalia she's very nice and shes good at customers and i love it
The best service really great customer service hands Down I wanna thank my. Server name irie you made our night thank you very much again

This place used to be decent, they got great potential unfortunately the service lately is ruining this place. My visit yesterday had the following issues: 1) Lady brought me my lemonade, tasted like tap water, had a strong chemical smell and taste, I asked her to replace it, she took my cup and never returned. 2) Another lady brought my my lunch, asked her to bring me my lemonade which she did after a few minutes and it had the same taste and smell as if they filled it out with the garden hose, no one was coming so I turned the call service button then the light started blinking, 3 employees went by it and ignored it, finally she came and asked her to replace it. 3) I started eating my dinner with no drink since it was getting cold, my son requested fries and ketchup, finally the drink arrived after I was almost done with my dinner and this drink finally tasted normal. 4) I was so thirsty I was hoping to get my refill, but no one came, and again we got forgotten since my son never got his fries or ketchup. 5) We just got fed up, our appetite was ruined, we payed our $50 for 3 hamburgers!, and requested my receipt via email, guess what? I never got my receipt :( Terrible service, next time ill just go to Islands on Eastlake, ill forget about Red Robin the way they forgot about us multiple times.

We waited and no one was there to seat us, then when someone did come. We asked if we could be be seated and she didn't say anything, she just picked up something from under the desk and left. Customer service sucks.

My daughter and I went to Red Robin this evening.   This was the second bad experience at this particular Red Robin.   Last time the service was nothing short of terrible.   This time my burger was bad.   I ordered the "wedgie burger" and when I began to cut it noticed it was well done.  I specifically ordered as close to medium rare as possible.  I understand RR doesn't cook medium rare but what about medium?   This burger had hockey puck status it was so over cooked.   It was barely lukewarm, my bacon was cold, and looked like it was the microwave brand.   What's worse, I began cutting the burger to eat and it looks like it was a frozen patty that one would purchase from Costco or Sam's Club.  Very disappointed.   If I wanted a fake microwave processed burger, I could have done that at home for less money.   Will not return.

We arrived at around 5:30 ish on a Friday evening and asked for a table of 5.  Started off well, we were sat in about 10 min....but then it went downhill.  2 ordered booze shakes, one got hers and one had to ask 4 times for hers to come long after her food came over an hour.  One of us got the wrong food.  When the runner came out with the food she spoke so quiet we couldn't here her and she had no idea of who got what food.  We had to ask for more napkins twice, waited over 10 min to get a knife to cut our burger.  Several of our drinks were empty for over 20 min with no one checking back on us to see if things were good did we need anything.  We asked for 1 refill of fries and that took forever as well.  When 2 of us asked for dessert the waitress stood on the opposite side of the table and made me repeat myself several times vs just walking over to my side of the table.  Plus our waitress kept telling us "you could have ordered that through the tablet machine on the table"  Did she not want to work...if i have to order my food on my own then why should i tip her?  One of our party went to the rest room and the toilet was not secured properly in the handicap stall and almost fell over.  When we kept asking about the missing shake we kept being told by 4 different people "oh lets see if it is at the bar"...then they never returned.  One of us spoke to the manager who said he would be over and after 15 min more of waiting we finally just paid our bill and got the heck out of there.  We will never eat here again.  No one there valued us enough to check back in on us and not long after we got our food we got our checks like they wanted us out.  Never had such poor service and it was sad that this was the end to our wonderful day we had spent out with friends.

Great hamburgers! I think the fries are yummy, couldn't get enough! The server was so sweet she got me another hamburger even though I accidently ordered the wrong one. She didn't even charge me for it. Amazing customer service!!!

One of the worst experiences I had at this restaurant. My boyfriend and I went for lunch and when we got there we were sat down with menus and told about the appetizers. We didnt get no napkins nor utensils the server didn't care and the manager sat looking around while we waited 20-30 min for our food. When I got my food my bun was as hard as toast and patty was cold. I had to wait on the server to come back and ask for my food cooked fresh. She brought my newer food out but it didn't seem fresh but at the end of our visit she wanted a tip. We will NOT be returning to this restaurant!

We went on Wednesday night, 8 p.m.  When we went in, there was no one up front, except a customer with a stack of togo containers.  It was at least 5 min before someone arrived, who looked like the manager.  He did not acknowledge us at all, and immediately addressed the man with the togo food.  It was obvious that this was not going to be settled quickly.   He should have asked the man to wait, or called another employee to help.  Instead he left us standing there, waiting, and still no acknowledgement.  Finally, he offered to seat us, nearly 15 min after we arrived.  He then took us a direction toward tables, but then discovered they were unseatable and reversed.  He wandered in another area and then asked another employee to take us to a table around the corner..   This type of customer service continued. A server came and asked for a drink order.  We got waters and she left.  I then flagged her down and asked if we were supposed to order on the screen which is on the table, because no one had asked for our order.  She said no and took our order.  The food came out from Jose, who was bustling around very busily.We had asked for silverware when we ordered, and still had none.  he said he would get it, and then went and had another order at the window.  There were FOUR female servers standing there doing NOTHING, including the one who took our order.  They did not lift a finger to help, and we still had no silverware, or napkins. Jose was running around helping others furiously, and eventually got us our silverware.  The servers stood there doing nothing and never checked on us.  Jose was attentive and friendly.   I had wanted mustard and lettuce and tomato, but since Jose seemed to be the only one doing anything I didn't ask.  The first set of fries and cole slaw were very good, but the refills were not.  Slaw was almost sauceless and fries were overcooked.  Burgers were very good, but I needed more toppings and didn't want to ask because of the service inconsistency.   We were charged for a "game" that I had declined, and had to have it removed.  I don't appreciate having to use the computer to pay myself and type all of the needed info, that's what servers are for, and why I eat out and not at home. I might try it again.  They need a lot of training on what customer service is, including the manager.  Bathroom was dirty. Jose was great.

Let me preface this by saying that I dont usually eat burgers, so I'm certainly hard to please when it comes to getting my order right. I got a margarita which were so good that I got a second round (especially since I don't normally drink, that's pretty big deal.)  I only like mushroom burgers without anything but the patty, cheese & mushroom plus I asked for extra mushroom & today I was served the perfect burger with a mountain of mushroom. (Bear in mind extra mushrooms meant that the bread would get soggy, but that's my own doing - besides I don't usually eat all of the bun anyways) Kudos to the server tonight (& I wish I had paid attention to her name, cuz she was great) so I have say getting my order right is definitely worth a mention. ... and of course Bottomless fries, which I like fat potatoey fries.  It's kickoff night so naturally it was loud, but not too busy & paying the check on the machine thing made it really easy to just get up & go. There's ample parking around the mall, or accessible by multiple bus routes. Locating the restaurant can be a bit tricky, it's upstairs by the food court & you actually have to walk outside to get to the front door.  Other than that I've never had a bad experience at this Red Robin.  Well done Management team!  Cheers

Went today with my girlfriend. Server was really nice, but the food wasn't. Ordered a California chicken and it looked like it came out of Carl's Jr. it was really sloppy and I had to cut it into pieces because everything kept falling out. And the fries? Oh man they were hard as a rock! Probably never coming back.

Super bad service, cold fries, no bacon on the burger that lists it, really dirty bathroom. My daughter's burger even had weird green goo on the bottom of her bun. This used to be one of our favorite chains, but this was the worst.

Discusting food( adult mac and cheese) service was absolutely terrible, horrible!! I've been a restaurant server for 8 years and I never experienced such a bad series of unfortunate customer service . Over all I give this place a negitave -3 stars. It's THAT bad

If you have kids this place is awesome. It's in the mall and I usually don't come to Plaza Bonita but we are having our truck serviced so they offered to drop us off here to wait instead of the dealership.  So happy we decided to pop in here for lunch. Zoey is pretty good in restaurants, but Red robin makes it easy to enjoy and finish a meal without a tummy ache later (you know because you're shoving food down so fast before the kids start screaming).  So hostess was very friendly and made room for the super wide mall stroller we were using right by our table so we wouldn't get it stolen.  and you want Miss Sammy as your server. She is so sweet. First time here and she is just so friendly and the absolute perfect server. Attentive but not too attentive. She had us covered, but we still were able to enjoy our meal. The food. So amazing. Try the chipotle dipping sauce. You will not regret it. I love the bottomless fries even though I absolutely don't need it but yes, I love sharing a few of them with Zoey so that I can order her a cup of fruit with her meal. All in all great experience.  I love how you have the option to pay at the table. The server drops the check, but if you pay with a card you can take care of it right away. No waiting around to get a card back and sign. What they are doing here is very efficient. I love it.  I think every place should be doing that. If they had a charging station I don't think I'd ever leave.

Planning to go to El Torito for lunch, but found the Plaza Bonita store closed.  Next door, Red Robin became Plan B.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  The restaurant was fairly empty. My wife ordered the Honey-Dijon Wings-N-Chips appetizer ($9.00) and was very pleased with it.  She offered me a wing and it was pretty good.  However, the chips had soaked up the wings dressing, and were soggy.  Probably not a good idea to serve them in a bowl together. My Red Robin Chili Burger ($10.39) was at best, average.  The burger patty was fine, but the chili smothering it was far too simplistic in taste:  Just chili powder and raw onion.  The fries were awful.  Not very warm at all, and leathery.  Obviously old, hard, reheated fries.  I pointed this out to our server, (by clanking a fry on my drink glass) and he offered a bowl of fries to go.  Nope, just wanted to inform you how awful the fries were.  Left most on the plate. Herllien, the server was fine.  The fries were the pits.  We'll avoid this place in the future.

My mom and I ate there last monday and the manager (Elizabeth) was amazing and so was her staff.  My waitress was janicia (i apologise if its spelled incorrectly) was wonderful.  Will continue to go there and i pray everyone else gives it a try as well. Love it, love it, love it!
I was being served by a man named Allen. He was nothing but rude to me at the bar. He gave me nothing but attitude and ruined my experience. Simply unacceptable for the customer service industry.

So I haven't been to this restaurant probably ever since it's been built at the mall. We went in with a big party for a birthday and our server was Joseline. Man from the get go this girl was kind and handled the big party like a breeze. Not once getting frustrated but did an amazing job and has everyone's orders correct. The food was actually pretty good as well. I liked the atmosphere it was very family oriented and the manager kept checking on us as well. Overall a very good 1st time experience and Joselines amazing customer service made the visit perfect. Will be back :)

Food was really good, but the services , is been one of the worse One I have experienced in a while, the host seen really upset, she forgot to put our name down, told us in 15 mins, and it took 30 minutes to get a table. Btw her name was Olga.

Keep the fries coming please! It keeps my little one busy and it means I don't have to buy him his own food that I know he won't finish anyways. Yes, that's right. Burgers come with bottomless fries and they were always nice and hot, not like they've been sitting on the kitchen counter waiting to be picked up. Just add a little seasoning OR dip em in Ketchup or BBQ sauce since they didn't even taste like they had a little salt on them.  Happy hour is from 3-6. Not a big menu but it's good enough. We ordered 2 full sized wings (Buffalo and BBQ) and also the Spinach and Artichoke Dip for 50% off. The wings came with some chips underneath them and the Spinach and Artichoke Dip was a little sour for me. Didn't enjoy that too much. I did however, enjoy my Reb Robin Burger with a side of BBQ Sauce. YUM! And took some Crispy Chicken Salad from my momma! Made me wish I had the Salad more. Maybe next time!

Our service today was not very good.  We had actually had two waitresses, the second took over the first, and the waitress ( Iridiana) was not a very good waitress.  It was a Sunday and it was busy, but the service was not acceptable, to the point I doubt I'll go in to any other Red Robin in San Diego or in general.   Ordered an Appetizer (chili cheese fries).  They're weren't bad, but no plates, utensils or NAPKINS!  We had to ask for some and by the time they brough them, our appetizer was almost done.They also didn't give my daughter her apple juice in a timely manner.  When it came time to check out, the waitress tried to be nice and social (too late), telling us about the survey (which I didn't do).  I shouldn't of tipped, but I did anyways.  On the portable pay kiosk they leave on the table, it asked for I think 20 percent, I lowered it to 10 percent or maybe a slight bit more than 10 percent.  I don't recommend this place, WORK ON YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  I used to work in customer service and I did a pretty decent job at it, you guys seriously need some work.  Our first waitress wasn't bad, the second waitress was bad.  Won't be coming back and I don't recommend dining here.  Go elsewhere.

Absolutely disgusting!!!  The food, service and overall cleanliness of the restaurant was horrible. Food: we order 2 of the tavern specials which allegedly had siracha however they both had no flavor and contained so much water as if they had been sitting in a broiler so long that the buns were soggy! We also ordered a signature black and blue burger which used to be my favorite...until today!My medium-rare cooked burger was fully pink inside. More like rare (not even medium rare). The black and blue burger had no flavor and was also was dripping wet; to the point my lettuce was wilted and my bun was soggy. Not juices just water!  Service: we waited patiently for our food which took a while as the waitress never followed up. We were never asked how our food was or if we needed anything.  And to top it all off: We were never asked if we needed more endless fries, therefore we asked for more fries being that our burgers were so horrible, and to our surprise the table (which was sat after us) received their endless fries but we were told sorry we are behind on fries and it may take a while. Cleanliness: the bathroom was cleaner than the sitting area which had crumbs, fries and broken crayons under the freshly buffed tables.  We won't be back,  and I would recommend that everyone reconsider before eating here.  In and Out is more gourmet with better quality food and service!

I came here for pickup and the service sucked. There was this young man at takeout but he was hardly there, i believe he was in the kitchen grabing orders and getting them ready. This poor lady was already waiting for her order before i got there and my order came out first( yay for me but i felt bad for her) The hosts are there and its not like theyre talking to each other but they dont really aknowledge people unless theyre for dine in. The takeout area needs a person to be helping out, it took 7 min for me to get aknowledged.

Just arriving in San Diego, starving as we try to hurry into town, this was the first restaurant we found.   The waitress must have noticed to hangry look on my face and felt the urgency to feed me because she promptly took our orders and brought out fries immediately for us to snack on while waiting for our burgers.  I thought it was awfully thoughtful of her to do so.  The dinner was juicy and oh my god, the onion rings were nice and crunchy!

Love the speed and friendly service. We ordered 5 burgers and received them nice and hot. My dads burger was actually mixed once with another table. They promptly replaced it with a new one. The waitress was kind and accommodating. We come here roughly once a month and always enjoy our time here

I guess my first experience back here after years was just so good that I had to leave a review. Well, last week I came here with a bunch of friends and my burger was incredible. Had a fresh beer with it and endless steak fries to make it complete. In addition, the New York Knicks game was on the huge screen TV right in front of me. I'll definitely keep coming back!

We came for dinner here since my bestie loves hamburgers. We arrived and waited about 5 minutes to be seated. We had the chili cheese fries and pretzel bites as appetizers and both were great. Our food and appetizers arrived in a timely manner. My burger was delicious but the bottomless fries seemed to be counted on my plate, Like someone was counting how many fries was on my plate. Overall good experience, however we kept having to remind our server to refill our drinks

I was here this past Sunday for lunch, 7 and 2 children and the service was very poor, she took for ever to take our drink order, and even longer bringing the drinks, then finally our food was served after 45 minutes of waiting, pretty simple dish, I had the honey mustard chicken bites, way to much honey on a layer of simple chips, my $4.50 Rasberry Lemonade taste like Strawberry Fanta soda, will not be back sorry :(

I went to Red Robin for the first time. It was my friend's birthday. We had great service and the food was really yummy. I highly recommend getting the garlic fries. The Magic Cookie Shake was really good with a nice cookie crunch. Jose was our server and he was always there to help us. I gave him a pretty good tip. It rare to go some where and the waitress or waiter are always there to help you.

I was disappointed with my overall experience. On a Sunday night, my two friends and I thought to head over to Red Robin's to satisfy some burger cravings and when we arrived we were rudely greeted and were told the wait would be 30min. The wait was fine, we spent the time inside the mall to keep busy. When we arrived after we had been notified of a table ready for us, we had to wait an additional 10 minutes. We were seated and got on with the ordering. Our waitress was nice but our food... Well that's a different story!! Our bottomless steak fries were hard, unseasoned, and cold. Our burgers didn't taste freshly made, and the overall wait time for our food was too long for what we ordered. I ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich and it didn't have enough barbecue sauce which left the burger bland. The only upside I had to this experience was their freckled lemonade which is an all time favorite of mine.  This place used to be of great quality and after this experience I can say that they're definitely lacking. But nonetheless, thank you to our server, Loralei, for her genuine efforts at keeping us content.

Today's experiance was exceptional!  The wait for our booth was about 8 minutes, not bad.  Our server James was AMAZING.  He was very attentive and on his game today.  He made sure his guest were well taken care of and made sure no one's drinks fell below empty.  James has set the bar up high for all RedRobin locations. If I was the district manager,  I would promote James to a manager right away!  Don't let this guy get away..  p.s.  his Piña Colada are on point.

Thoroughly unimpressed. Came here because I found out they had poutine (I've been on a poutine hunt). The ingredients should all meld together into a delicious stack of fries covered in gooey melty yumminess, but this wasn't the case at all. The fried cheese curds did not mesh well with the rest of the plate. The gravy was some bland generic brown variety. My girlfriend got a veggie burger that fell apart and didn't have much taste. Won't be back!

This establishment provided great service. I forgot the waitress's name but she definitely provided great customer care. Always checking up on us and asking if we need anything, refilling our drinks, and giving us good feedback on what to order. For appetizers we got the fried pickles and onion rings and they were spot on.

Very very good! The burger meat had a delicious flavor with the cheese melted on top of it, the fries were mouth watering. Service was great, we walked in and were warmly welcomed to a table swiftly, I have to say, their original seasoning was amazing, 10/10 would recommend!
Had mac and cheese. Was cold, dry, and completely tasteless. A really lousy experience. I wouldn't recommend this place.

Janicia is one of the best waitresses ever!!! She brought me what I wanted 3 separate times during the meal before I could even ask for it. I wish she could be my waitress at every restaurant!! This location is very good too I have been here many times and never left unhappy.

location: Carmel Mountain Ranch, San Diego, CA
review: I like this place... delicious burgers especially the A1 burger. always have to order the onion rings tower and share it with the table. don't forget to become a member and start earning your free burgers (especially if you are a frequent flyer of this establishment)
